I was extremely disappointed with my first experience here. I had heard from everyone that this place was so amazing so maybe my expectations were too high.   The atmosphere is very nice, relaxed, and aesthetically pleasing. I had a delicious apple cider to start. Then things got meh.  I ordered chicken and waffles and they were wings with barely any meat on them and slightly burned. They arrived at my table stacked on a weird coil thing and a wooden plank. I had a tiny bread plate which was ridiculous to try to cut up a chicken wing on. I paid 13 dollars for maybe 8 bites of chicken and mediocre waffles.  One of my friends got chicken wings which were also burned and the same friend was informed that her food was given to a different table when we all had our food. Luckily we had some to share with her.  The desert we shared was great though.  I would not recommend this place to anyone unless you are going for drinks and a snack. Do not go here if you are hungry or on a budget.

Man this place is such a charming and amazing space that I wanted to like it so badly.  So cute!  Maybe my high expectations skewed my opinion? I had a flight of beers, which were good, but none were super amazing.  The porter was my favorite. We got the beer cheese with pretzels app.  OK pretty good - I'm getting excited for my flatbread after.  It was completely unremarkable unfortunately. I can forgive so-so food if there is amazing service, or vice-versa, but unfortunately that wasn't the case either.  The service left a lot to be desired as well.

I've been here several times, specifically for the brunch buffet which I learned is only on Sunday. I came here for a friend's bday brunch, fully expecting to devour the brunch buffet and much to my surprise there was no buffet bc it's Saturday. Sigh. Their brunch menu still has good options. After debating over a few options, I decided to go with the Carne asada flat bread and the truffle fries. When my Flatbread cane out, it was cold. So I knew it had been sitting out for a while before I got to my table. I asked them to re-warm it for me. The Carne asada Flatbread is pretty good. I do wish that it had a bit more steak on it though. I loved the fresh cilantro and pico that came on the Flatbread. I generally enjoy all of Heist's Flatbreads. The truffle fries were okay. I love truffle fries but they're becoming more of the norm than a specialty at this point. I thought that they could've used a bit more truffle oil. The truffle was subtle and seemed to get lost on the fry. I also had the champagne flight which includes 5 pours. I substituted the elder flower mimosa for a poinsettia mimosa. The only mimosa on the flight that I did not like was th kir royal. I didn't mind the raspberry flavor, I just thought the liquore was way too sweet. Troy was our server and he did a good job holding us down as we were a big party of 10.

After finding the correct door to enter Heist, we entered and were quickly impressed by the decor  with the wooden covered walls,  large pieces of artwork, glass enclosed brewery, and live edge wooden tables.  I wasn't there for food - although I may have to go back for it.   I tasted the Strawberry Blonde beer and would only give it 3 out of 5 stars.  It had a very red color but it was missing something.  They had a good selection of beers as well as home made sodas.

My oh my this place has changed.   So, my wife and I live in NoDa, and we were pretty excited when this place opened up a few years back. I remember coming for the first time, ordering the beer cheese, a Hefeweizen, and a burger with tots.   The beer cheese we fell in love with. The burger - one of the best in the city. The beer ... ok, but went fairly well with the food. Really, the selling point to us was the great atmosphere and the food.   Fast forward to our recent experience there. The awesome burgers - gone. The decent beer ... Still just meh. Thank god the beer cheese is still being served and the service was still great! But the menu change is so disappointing! Now it's shared plates. I ordered the burger burger burger plate which is essentially 3 sliders. And you can't specify how you'd like the meat cooked - so obviously my patties were a bit over cooked to my liking. The fries were mediocre. Blah blah blah.   Idk... I live in the neighborhood and I don't know if I'll be back, honestly. Even the bathroom was bit a filthy with no hand soap except for a watered down bottle of dove hand wash. That was weird. The food used to be incredible. Not so much anymore. And the beer isn't good enough to make it a destination spot. Love you Heist, but you've got some work to do! And please do, we miss the great menu!

I don't even know if I can really comment on this spot. I mean I can't go into great detail. I was here for the CLT does Sade thing. I'm not going to fault this place for the okay vocalists or even the dude that rambled on in the beginning talking about the same things over and over for like 40 minutes. This has nothing to do with the spot.   I bet it's cute on a chill type vibe. Get a little drinky drink, you can chill outside where it's well lit. That's what I did. I still heard the music and I was able to people watch. Cause it was literally packed in that joint. And unless I'm dancing and the people around me are too, I can't do the stand around while people brush up against and past me.   I'm going to have to check this place out for a chill night of drinking cause I can see how the vibe is.

First off, the place is gorgeous.  Rustic, charming.  You can smell the wood-burning oven.  It's cozy, inviting.  I wasn't in a hurry to leave.  Our waitress was okay.  Not terribly friendly.  I felt as though we were bothering her.  The beer was pretty good.  Not the best, not the worst.  Nothing terribly noteworthy, but I'd sit down with another glass of Succession with a meal.  Which brings me to the food.  WOW!  Clearly not an afterthought.  Beer Cheese Burger on Pork Belly Brioche?!  Who does that?!  AH-mazing.  (Pro-tip:  add bacon jam.)  And Parmesan Truffle Fries - to die for.    I'd mainly go back for the food and the atmosphere & have a beer while I'm there.  Although, if you're mainly JUST looking for a really good beer, this may not be the best of choices.  Go there for the food, stay for the beer.

Husband and I are on a brewery crawl for our anniversary and this was our first stop in the NoDa area. We tried everything on tap and only didn't fancy one. Our favorites were the succession, french toasted joe, black market and dude, where's my coffee!

We visited for the first time after recommendations from friends.  The place was just starting to get busy and by the time we left,  it was packed.   We were greeted and seated quickly (note:  lots of backless stools with high-top tables which I don't prefer); however,  we found a conventional table 4-2 by the door.   We ordered the Lamb Balls and Lobster Mac.  Both were great with the lamb being the winner.   The lobster mac was left a little long under the grill and was almost burned,  and it had a watery vs. creamy base.   Overall, it's a neat place and is true to the vibe of NoDa.  So why a low score?   Price.  Our tab with a $10 tip was $67 for two people.  One order of lamb balls,  one order of lobster mac,  one pint, and two glasses of house chardonnay--ouch! for a funky, neighborhood bar.  We asked for some bread to sop up the wonderful lamb sauce (so good).  Our waiter brought us four thin slices of toasted baguette and charged us $4.  Mac $18.  House wine $8 a glass.   The best deal was the pint at $4.50.  But, hey, what do I know?  They're busy!  At this price point, however, they have loads of higher end competitiion in Charlotte.  I doubt we will visit much opting for $9 fish tacos just up the street.

Wonderful.  We both had the Brewmaster Burger with rrosemary tater tots - wow!  I think it may have been the best burger I've ever had, and those tater tots are NOT what you get from the grocery store!  For a beer, I chose the I2PA and I thought it was excellent.  And on top of that, the service was just great.

We went here because we saw it on "DDD" the food was good. Had the , burger burger burger, which did not disappoint. We also tried the pork belly taco which were also good. Service was ok. My disappointment was in the cleanliness of the place. Not just your normal messiness from a busy day, but filthy. The wall behind the long booth was disgusting and looks like it had never been cleaned. The window chill was caked with old food and dirt.  Makes you wonder what the kitchen looks like.

Came here on a Sunday afternoon on a beautiful spring day. Sat on the patio and enjoyed a couple good brews. Very chill, relaxing environment with a great band playing in the background. Made for a perfect day. Good service, good beer, great patio.

I live in the neighborhood and have eaten here at least 10 times over the years and the food is just always terrible.  The menu items look to have potential but they are never executed.  It is certainly not known for the beer and I don't understand how they remain open with the terrible quality of food. I ordered tonight hoping that maybe this time would be different but it wasn't. I think in the future I will just have to say no thanks when friends want to eat here. I definitely do not recommend.

My friends and I decided to try Heist Brewery this past Sunday for brunch. Upon arriving around 11:20, I was told a wait for 6 would be about 30 minutes. No problem, definitely expected this as I've heard that their brunch is a big deal. I was pleasantly surprised when our table was ready in about 7 minutes.  Our server Amanda was great, very personable and quick with our bottomless mimosa refills. The brunch buffet was delicious! The grits were creamy and seasoned perfectly, the gravy was fantastic and I definitely can't forget mentioning the grilled rum soaked pineapple- out of this world. While most buffet items were labeled, there were a few that were not and I wasn't for sure what they were.  I have been to Heist before and sampled their brews, which have always been good. I stuck with the bubbly on Sunday, but had a few friends who tried their beer say that they were flat... Probably a simple carbonation problem.  All in all, a fantastic experience. Definitely planning another trip there this Sunday!

This place is cool! It feels like you're in a copper factory or mill of some sort. Unique decor and art style. Their beer selection is great and if you're a fan of cocktails, they have a good selection of those too that are served in some unique glass wear. The food is only okay.  This place is great for a gathering or after work night cap!

Go for the brunch, they say. I did. It was A-OK in my book.  Heist is ideal if you want to roll out of bed, throw on a t-shirt, and eat your heart out hoping to appease any signs of a hangover from having a few too many cocktails the night before. They have a buffet filled with scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, cheese & meats, flatbreads, chicken wings, and a donut tree...and a lot more. You can order one made-to-order dish like Eggs Benedict. The waffles were not that great - a tad on the soggy side. My friend told me about the donut tree and I was very intrigued; I love donuts. I guess I'm used to restaurants making things in-house these days, so you can imagine the disappointment when I saw the employee restocking the tree from a box labeled Krispy Kreme! Don't get me wrong, the disappointment faded once I took a bite...Krispy Kreme is still a winner.  I definitely felt like an older patron and way over dressed in my cotton dress and heels. Like I said before, it's a t-shirt, yoga pants, team jersey sort of place.  They can't serve alcohol before noon on Sundays, but the moment the clock strikes twelve they walk through the building ringing a bell and then the mimosas and Bloody Mary's fly out of the bar.  Make reservations. They pack the house early and stay consistently busy.

My boyfriend and I decided to ditch our plans at an overly priced restaurant with a prix fixed menu that we weren't all that jazzed about to try Heist. Let me say we were both SO happy to go.  He is the beer person and he said the beers were pretty good. He said sure NoDa's beers might be a little bit better but it is obvious how much emphasis is put on the food, which they don't have.  He had the Belgian Dubbel, the I2PA, and the Porter. All of which he enjoyed.  I tried two cocktails: both were awesome. Their cocktails are about as creative as the food. I had the Paloma de Pama, which is a tequila drink with chipotle salt around the rim, and the Stowaway, which comes in a tiki cup with an umbrella. Both were great.  Food-wise, we started with the 7-layer shots. Highly recommended, a very unique combination of flavors. We continued on to the duck flatbread, which was good but was probably my least favorite of the dishes we had. It has a very smoky taste. Then we had the steak and potatoes - YUM, you should try this. Last we ordered the salmon tacos, the salmon was sushi-grade so it almost tasted like tuna. Lastly, the banana eggrolls.  The ambiance was awesome, our server was awesome, I would definitely recommend and I will definitely be back!!

Came here on the strength of the generally positive reviews. The comments about staff friendliness, attentiveness as well as the variety and flavor of the beers is all true.   Unfortunately so too are comments about the food. The hummus and goat cheese, cleverly presented in tubes was okay. The tofu steak I ordered was burnt. Prices are reasonable. Overall impression, if you are planning to come here for the beer, I think you will be pleased. If you're planning to dine there is the potential you will be disappointed.

I died and went to bar food heaven! EVERYTHING I had was good. They hosted all 18 of us for our Holiday party upstairs on 12/18/14 and the server was so funny, very fast and never let a pint or glass go empty. BEER CHEESE DIP!!!! BACON WRAPPED DATES!!! FRIED RIBS!!! all of it was to die for. We tried many things. I cant review beer as I am not a beer drinker however they make a cider cocktail and oh  my god its apple pie in a glass with a straw! Also they make a great mule. I will be back this is on my hit list. this is a great place for a big crowd.

Stopped in because I have driven past this place several times. Delicious food, great beer, and a fun atmosphere!  I highly recommend the Fry Basket Ribs and Banana Eggrolls. Pure heaven!  We happened to be sitting next to Chef Rob and his family - fun people. We will be back and cannot wait to try the new menu additions coming soon.

My husband and I met a few friends we hadn't seen in awhile for dinner and drinks this past weekend. We had all been before but tonight we sat at the bar that is closest to N Davidson (next to the patio) and then grabbed a table back there when we got hungry.  The bartender asked what I gravitate toward, cocktail wise, and I threw out some things and he made me a great variation of a margarita. I then ordered a Paloma. Good stuff.  Food wise we got way too much. The Mac n Cheese pizza, pretzels, tot chos (tater tot natchos), salmon belly tacos and something else. The dishes come out as they are ready and it didn't take long before the food started coming at us.  We enjoyed the food, drinks and service and they were playing good music too which always helps get you in a Friday night mood!

Between 3.5/4 stars- Finally getting around to review this place. We went for brunch on Sunday with our friends who live in the area. This is going to be a longer review because I have a hard time giving it a review overall.   Ambience- 5 stars. They have a perfect corner location. The outside seating is awesome and the inside has a really unique feel. Love all the screens that they have around the entire restaurant.   Price- 3 stars. It was $19 a person for brunch and we found that out when we got the check because the price wasn't listed anywhere on the menu. Not really a fan of that.  Food (I'm going to have to separate it into a la carte and the buffet)- Buffet- 5 stars. Mussels. That's all. Just kidding, they had different cheeses, eggs & grits, biscuits & gravy, turkey sausage, bacon, some wonderful pineapple, four or five different flatbreads and a carving station.  A la carte- 3 stars. While the descriptions sounded so amazing, between the four of us, none of us loved the "main dish" that we got. They seemed like unique ideas, but we noticed they were all super filling which made us think they wanted us to go to buffet less. Meh.   There's a good chance we will go back when we make another trip to Charlotte, but maybe just for beers or their regular menu.
Very tasty veggie wrap w/chili spiced edamame.  I'm not a lover of spice & was able to consume the majority of the edamame.  This was a delicious healthy meal.  Service was top notch!

Brunch is brunch is brunch, right?  WRONG.    I'd heard many a great thing about Heist's Sunday brunch, but figured it couldn't be as special as everyone was making it out to be.  I expected to find the eggs, bacon, pastries, and fruit spread that is so standard at most restaurant brunches.  And yes, Heist does offer these items at its brunch buffet, but you would be doing yourself a disservice if that was all you ate.  Roasted ham, beets, and carrots; egg salad; pastry wrapped brie and blueberries; homemade donuts; biscuits and gravy; vegetable stuffed quiche; marshmellow topped sweet potato/pumpkin casserole; omelettes; and of course the meringue-topped chocolate chip waffles!  I don't even like waffles but you had better believe I'm going back to Heist this Sunday for another waffle...or two!  My only criticism is that they don't serve those tasty parmesean rosemary tots during brunch (or maybe they do and I just didn't ask).  Looks like I'll just have to go back for lunch or dinner to sample some more of those.  Oh, woe is me!

Omg I really love this place! I've been here multiple times and every time is great! From the very pleasant hostess, to the great decor, awesome service and even better food! Oh and let's not forget the beer, craft cocktails, and brunch buffet!!! Last time I went I had beer cheese(every time I go!), chicken wings(full wing) with amazing flavor, and a flatbread pizza. Needless to say, they were gobbled up and washed down with a refreshing hoppy brew. My mouth is watering right now. If you wanna go and have no one to go with, hit me up! Nomnomnom!

Just ate here for first time today. Family in from Florida. Family & friends live at Highland Mills.   Sadly not a pleasurable experience:   1) Slow server/checked back once 2) Buffet food less than mediocre  3) Eggs Benedict served no Hali sauce/ice cold 4) Sausage has weird spice or was spoiled 5) Dirty bar area/smelled of soiled sour towels likely from bad bar cleanup post Saturday night. 6) Buffet area so dark cannot see food  7) Shrimp and grits had ONE shrimp sliced in half folded over to look like two shrimp (are you kidding me!?)  $19.00 - plus tip per person   Arrival time 10:45am (brunch buffet opened at 11am)   Heist is geared for a young party crowd - hungover and typically without refined pallets. I would not recommend. If you MUST go I recommend only the ala cart veggie omelette.

The one thing I go to Heist for is BRUNCH! There brunch buffet is delicious and you also get to order one personal entree included in buffet price. My person favorite from the buffet is the rum soaked pineapple with marscapone cheese. The best entree is the steak and eggs which is made with short ribs and a spicy white BBQ sauce. In addition to this amazing buffet at noon the establishment begins bottomless mimosas and Bloody Mary flights. The servers are on top of the mimosa refills, its hard to finish one before you get another! One negative is the wait, even though the restaurant is huge they don't accept reservations and its always packed. This is a brewery which I personally don't care for their beer, brunch is definitely their strong point.

One of my favorite Charlotte breweries that's much more than a mere brewery. Craft Beer, Bottomless Mimosas and Brunch, who can ask for more?  Favorite Beers: 1. Succession 2. Cross Pollen-nation  Location: 4/5    Near the border of NoDa; only of a couple blocks away from all the action. Parking can be tight sometimes  Atmosphere / Ambiance: 4/5     Think of a cross between a restaurant and brewery. Lot's of space and tables so larger parties can be accommodated relatively easy. The establishment is well lit and the table seating makes it less of a bar atmosphere so if you're looking to co-mingle, you might want to try else where.  Cleanliness: 5/5    Neat as a whistle  Service: 5/5    I've always had a positive experience with the servers and bartenders each time I've been there.   Food: 4/5 Heist has solid brunch. Bottomless Mimosas for $10 and an All-You-Can-Stuff-Your-Face buffet for around $15-18. That's good boozing and munching right there. There was one time when the buffet was off once, but eh it happens. Give there flat breads a try. The Chicken and Waffle flat bread was pretty interesting and yummy.  Booze: 5/5 A solid array of craft beers. My two favorites are mentioned above. A flight is always a good option to try out what they have to offer. Is a Growler too much for ya? Then take home a Crowler. Goodness in a can.

Enjoyed the food and drink. Ambiance was great. But did get seated in a weird corner. Service was nothing to rave about. But my drink The Horny Toad and my friends The Mule were both very good. On the expensive side but I milked it. Ordered the Bacon Flatbread and The Spicy wings. We were very pleased with the food. Two cocktails and two appetizers came out to about 40.00 bucks. Not to bad. Will come back.

I have been to Heist for drinks. I have been for their innovative dinner fare. You should go for their Sunday brunch. Mega brunch. Its a buffet with plenty of made to order options and orange juice is included. $16 gets you the traditional, savory and sweet choices - ammmmazing grits, some kind of extra special pineapple and plenty of more lunchy choices too. Its divine.

I'm a big fan of Heist. A couple of brews, some snacks and chilling out on their patio in the sun is definitely a good time.   I've been to Heist a few times and my absolute favorite thing is the patio (especially since it has been so nice out). Sometimes there is a band, which is nice. I've been here a few times and had some snacks; I've had the soft pretzels, spinach & artichoke flatbread and the nutella eggrolls - all really good and perfect if you're not starving and just feel like munching. They also have this Apple cooler cocktail thing that is fantastical. All around, everything is really good in the taste and ambiance department.  Service. All of my servers and bartenders have been really good! Super cool and attentive. The hostesses are like...really strict with the seating situation. All 3 times I have been there, the place has not been busy - as in, there are several tables open in the bar area and the patio, yet, we are told there is a 25 minute wait and that we can sip at the bar only (not the bar section, the literal bar). Ok...but after 25 minutes when I haven't seen anyone else be seated in any of the said tables nor had anyone really come in after us, it's a little strange. I have had to ask the hostess what the deal is at least 2 times before the finally seat us. I don't know, I don't get it, I guess. This wouldn't stop me from coming here or telling people how much I love Heist, just something I expect when I go here.

Went on a mini brewery crawl this weekend stopping at Triple C, Heist, Birdsong, and finishing with dinner at Growlers Pourhouse. Started with Triple C, now for the next stop in our evening out... Charlotte's newest brewpub; Heist Brewery.  Situated in the cultural hub of NoDa, Heist occupies the old Highland Mill building. The place is beautiful... just the right mix of new and old. You get some very nice woodwork and stonework adorning the walls, while at the same time preserving the history of the space. When you walk in there is an open space with several tables and a bar, as you pass through into the next area you pass a kitchen area with a custom wood burning pizza oven that is open to the rest of the space so that the aroma of pizza baking fills the whole building. Once you stop gawking at the pizza oven you will notice a wall full of windows showcasing the brewhouse, and another bar area. Really, in addition to being eye catching and well laid out the place is huge, there is upstairs seating and yet a third bar type area with seats and tap handles. I could hang out here all day  The service is decent, the waiter we had was attentive and polite. He tried to be helpful, and knew a fair amount about the menu, but very little about the beer.   Now, on to the menu... I feel like this place has fallen victim to "celebrity chef syndrome". To many dishes that try to be just a bit too clever. Too little food for too high a price.  Lobster Bisque Test Tubes, BBQ Braised Pork Belly Corn Dogs, Asian Shrimp with Lemon Wasabi Cotton Candy?, Chicken and Waffles... C'mon man!! The burgers, and flat breads don't look too bad, but lets stop trying so hard to be the next food network star.  Now on to the main attraction... The beer. Unfortunately I am underwhelmed by the beer. Eleven house made beers on tap and all of the mediocre at best. How about we cut the beer menu down to a manageable four or five offerings and make the shine!! I don't need ten or eleven beers from a new start up brewery, I need two or three beers that blow my hair back (back when I had hair). We ordered two samplers so that we could try all of the beers, I thought the oatmeal stout was the best beer of the bunch. I would go on to describe the rest of them but I forgot about them even as I was drinking them. Now, don't get me wrong. None of the beers were deeply flawed, just uninspired. While none of them knocked my socks off, none of them were offensive or had bad off flavors either, just boring. I'm not looking for crazy, extreme beers, just good beers done well.  I really wanted to like this place. I was pulling for them to be the next great Charlotte area brewery... and they still could be, but there is work to be done.  All in all I am ready for the next place, on to Birdsong...

I've read and heard mixed reviews of Heist Brewery, so I was not quite sure what to expect.  My diagnosis: I'm a fan!  First, the atmosphere - the place is great for eating or just hanging out with a really nice vibe.  Second, the drinks. Although I cannot attest to the beer,  as I am not a beer-drinker, the cocktails were delicious. They were tasty, flavorful and unique. Lastly, the food.  I ordered the crab burger and was pleasantly surprised.  The crab burger at Heist was massive and yummy.   I think the small portions comments will really depend on what you give.  Some of the appetizers are going to be very small; however, the burgers are huge and come with a side.   I do have a complaint - I am not a HUGE fan of the 'tater tots,' I appreciate the attempt to put a homemade twist on an old classic, but either the potato insides need to be more cooked, or the outside needs to be a little crispier.   Bottom Line:  I think this is a great place for groups, hangouts and grabbing a bite -- probably not the best for an intimate date- but other than that, I got no complaints!

Sunday Brunch  Though I have been to Heist about a dozen times for dinner or drinks, today was my first time going for brunch.   Unlike some other brunch spots, Heist has plenty of seating and parking.  Though busy our group was seated right away on the patio. While there over 90 minutes I didn't notice anyone waiting more that a minute to be seated, and that was only if the hostess was away from her stand seating an earlier party.   The breakfast buffet was nice (scrabbled eggs, grits, bacon, turkey sausage, chicken wings, mussels, variety of cheeses and hard meats, breakfast flat breads, unlimited OJ and apple juice) plus one Ã  la cart item.   There was a regular menu that I didn't look at as the group had already decided on the buffet when I arrived.   I knocked off one star because the waiter could have stopped by 1-2 more times to offer coffee (my cup was empty for about 10 minutes) and the price was about $3-5 higher than I think it could be.
Met some friends here and shared a few dishes. The pimento cheese flatbread is amazing. My husband and I can't wait to go back and work our way through the menu.

I was only in town for one evening, and this greatly limited my options. It seems that Charlotte has had a ton of new brewpubs open up within the past five years. The only issue to me, however, was that nearly none of them were open past 9:00 pm on a Tuesday night. So I headed to Heist Brewery, pretty much the only one in town that is.  I found the space to be quite lovely. Despite a nondescript exterior in an industrial part of town, the interior had been done-up quite nicely with great light fixtures, beautiful bars, a ton of space and a pretty high-class feel. The only issue I had was with the floor in the main seating area, which wasn't leveled during finishing causing the high-top tables and chairs to wobble on a consistent basis.  While I found the place to be nicely classy, I found the food to be overly so, to the point of being pretentious. I do not need any of my food to be served in test tubes (the bisque) or on top of a flat rock (torched diablos). What's more, the small plates are exorbitantly priced, typically costing about a dollar per bite.  Take, for example, the tater tots. Even if they are the best tater tots in the world (they're not), I still think a side order of them should come with more than four morsels of food.  On the other hand, the burger I shared with my fiance was fairly priced at $9 and quite delicious. A blend of smoked brisket and porterhouse tail is an awesome idea, and putting bacon and caramelized onions on top is always a good idea. So I have mixed feelings about the menu. While some options are pleasantly priced and inventive, much of it goes overboard.  I wish they'd take some of that culinary inventiveness and apply it to their brewing. Every option I tried was tired and boring. Some of them were very bland, while a couple of them were quaffable. Perhaps the brewery just has some growing up to do, or needs a bit more practice. But whatever the reason, I was not impressed by the beer in the least.  On a final note, the service was a bit much at times. While attention is nice, dropping by the table every five minutes becomes annoying at some point, as does terrible jokes and lame descriptions of the beer. While I give an A for effort, again, the execution just isn't quite there.
Loved the beer, the brunch and the atmosphere. Great management and a fantastic experience. We will be back!

Thanks to Clayton and the head chef our first experience here was over the top enjoyable. They were both super accommodating. The food was delicious and the beer is great.   We will certainly return. Thanks! Btw special request honey mustard. It is delicious. Thanks Chef.

Heist is cool... Sometimes a bit too cool... The beer is fantastic but the food is hit or miss. High prices for small portion sizes (tapas style) eats that are meh. Squeezing hummus and goat cheese out of a metal roll tube... I'll pass. Brunch was a swing and a miss. Buffet style with food that just didn't do it.   Go for the beer and atmosphere. Eat somewhere else.

Wow. This place is expansive. Envisioning the old property when it was Prevue is not even fair. The old front door is storage, so walk around the side at the front of Highland Mills and into the newest and most unique dining experience in Charlotte.  Walking back passed the kitchen and front bar and into the dining area is awesome. Not in the 80's way, but in the way that inspires awe. The smells from the kitchen permeate throughout with a delicious meaty overtones. Walked upstairs for a birds eye view, we started with the pimento cheese crab dip, pork belly corn dogs and chicken and waffles. The last of which is the all star of the limited opening night menu. The honey and orange zest NAIL it. Washing it all down with an oatmeal stoudt, a station #7 red ale, a hefeweizen, a light lager, and a blueberry pale ale is par for the fantastic course... I will be back for brunches in two weeks.

I came here with my family for lunch one weekend and it was fantastic. They have an outdoor seating area which would have been wonderful if they had room for us! We sat inside right near the brewery area and we all sampled different kinds of beer which were all fantastic. Seriously, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  I had the bruschetta flatbread which was delicious. The fire roasted tomatoes were incredibly sweet and delicious and the balsamic was the perfect touch. Some other items that my family ordered were the fish tacos, bbq burger, chicken parmesan sandwich and the duck flatbread. All of them were very very happy. I can't wait to go back and sample something else on the menu!
Fantastic beer and atmosphere- you must try the beer cheese dip!  Pretty busy on weekends but tables are cool, and it's fun to be able to see the brewery area through the wall of glass!

The food is good and rather creative but unfortunately that's the best of it. Of the four local NoDa breweries Heist has the worst beer.  The service is rather terrible as well.  I went yesterday with a large party to have some drinks and watch the World Series but the bartender was rude and too lazy to change the channel for us although they had the same football game on 4 tvs.  I asked to speak to the manager from a polite waitress and after waiting for more than ten minutes we left.  So if you're looking for mediocre beer, bad service, and some good food this is your place.

Not a fan of tapas in the first place. No worries if it is just an option on the menu but I went there expecting a full meal and spent $30 and left hungry with no notable experiences.  Wish they'd go to a menu with full course meals.

Went long while back, first time having chicken and waffles and they were amazing. Heard chicken and waffle tacos are lacking.   Supposedly food has gone downhill since, but still interested in finding out if true myself.
Fun, Funky place. Great food, a good signature drink is the Moscow Mule/Texan Mule. Relaxed atmosphere with a good feel, nice servers.

First of all was seated right by the door.  Don t usually have a problem with that until we realized our waitress had all of the tables in that area which were 2 huge parties of at least 20 each!   Wish I was exaggerating!  So we all know that was the kiss of death for service.  She already had 40 people she was waiting on NOT her fault.  I hope the beer lines had been just cleaned and they hadn't rinsed them. The V.9 tasted like soap. Not that I could ask for something else because she was in the weeds.  The carne asada meat looked anemic and was  tuff.  The chicken salad had the greens grilled and the chicken cold.    Needless to say not impressed only gave it a 2 because it's not the waitresses fault that they over seated her with no help!  Probably 4 times try and done!

My husband and I like trying new breweries when we are traveling, so we decided to try Heist Brewery when we were in Charlotte today.  We were the first people in the restaurant when they opened at 11:30 AM and were seated immediately. Our server brought us waters and we decided to order a flight of beers from their list of about 12 beers. The flight was reasonably priced, with 5 generous pours for $6.   The beers that we tried were: I2PA, peach hefeweizen, Belgian tripel, maibock and a stout. Personally, I liked the peach hefe and the maibock (my favorite). I thought the stout was too dry. I really did not care for the Belgian tripel and I am normally a big fan of Belgian style beers. I did not try the IPA personally, but my husband said it was his favorite. After our flight, I ordered a peach hefe in a pint and my husband ordered the pale ale. He liked the pale as well. So overall, the beers were a little hit or miss, but the hits were good ones!  We also ordered lunch. I ordered the pressed cheese sandwich with the rosemary tater tots. The sandwich was a warm pimento cheese sandwich topped with sweet pickles. It was served on jalapeno-bacon focaccia bread. The sandwich was fantastic. It was surprisingly spicy and the flavor of the bread added a lot to the sandwich. My husband ordered the Italian sandwich. He also was a big fan of his sandwich. All of the breads here are homemade, and it showed. The tots were good, but not outstanding and the portion size was small (four tots each).  Our server was very friendly and attentive and the space itself is very cool. It is a fun industrial setting with a large bar and plenty of seating. The interesting food menu definitely has a lot of potential!  We will return the next time we are in Charlotte!
Love this place and my first attempt at brunch here did not disappoint at all. Great food and plenty of it with a variety of the Heist menu items to try.

Everything is amazing here. There's a reason Guy Fieri stops here any time he is in the area.  The food is beyond amazing, service is exceptional and they have a huge choice of beers.  Only thing I wish I could change would be to have the ability to get their beer closer to home (they do not distribute).  Will be back over and over again.  If you don't come here your a FOOL!

For a brewery with such great character and location, you would think/hope the customer service would be acceptable especially on a Saturday night. I have never been a fan of the heist brews (I enjoy almost every craft beer I've tried) and this 3rd visit will be my last even for the menu and atmosphere.

Great beer. So-so food.   Seriously, why would you serve hummus and goat cheese in toothpaste-esqu tubes. The bruschetta was over the top in terms of quanity but kinda flavorless.  Good beer cheese.   Beer is fantastic, I'll be back for that.

Ok Heist, I've liked you in the past, but tonight was a pretty dick move.  My girlfriend and I head in about 12:30 am for some sweet eats - and stand forever by the sign that says "Please wait HERE to be seated".  After the torture of being ignored for an extended period, we helped ourselves to some menus and wandered over to the bar and sat down where we were ignored by the bartender until I could finally make it impossible for him to avoid me, and then he tells us you don't serve food after midnight.  Not entirely sure how we were supposed to know that?  I'm assuming we would have still been standing by the hostess sign until 2 when you close.  Please work toward making the night time service as good as the food.

Got the American Cheeseburger with Truffle Fries.  All very good, and the spicy mayo was a nice touch.  That said, nothing really unique or outstanding.  Service was good, beer was cold.  Not a bad meal.

House Brewed Sarsaparilla Root Beer might be the Best Brew reviewed so far (by anyone)!  I'm giving the Root Beer close to five yelp stars!  Next time we will get the House Brewed Cherry Soda and I'll request it in a Frosted Mug with No Ice!  This Soda is carrying the review!  This place is Cool!  They did a great job decorating!  It is BELIEVABLE!  Big Bar and nice sized Dinning Room in the front, smaller Bar and Bigger Dinning Room with Huge Glass wall so you can see the Brewery in the back!  Balcony Dinning Room overlooks the Brewing room and large Dinning Room!  Nice smaller outdoor Patio!  The Service was Excellent and if it were not for our server recommending a House Brewed Soda this would be a 2 star review!  The Service gets 5 stars!  Everyone was Friendly and pleasant!  Even though I would rather have rude or snobby Service and MUCH Better food, great Service is nice and I guess I appreciate it, really I do NOT expect it, though it weighs very light in my reviews!  The food is bringing my review stars down!  Since my math skills suck (means this is probably really a 2 1/2 star review) and this was my first dine (they have not been open very long either) I'll be gentle!  The Root Beer was a Great start!  The Root Beer BBQ Sauce was very good and probably saved the Pork-belly Corn-dogs which did not have much flavor and what flavor they did have was NOT good!  Pork-belly Corn-dogs without BBQ Sauce get 2 yelp stars and with the BBQ Sauce get 3 stars!    Duck and Shallot Flat-bread with Mozzarella Cheese and Root Beer BBQ Sauce would have been better without the Duck (call it Shallot and Mozzarella Flat bread) or they could have put More Duck and we may have known we were eating Duck... Meaning the Duck was a little more like Bacon bits.  Still the Flavor was good enough for 3 stars, more would be too generous!  Now for the worst part of the review... We asked for the most unique Dessert they had since we knew we were going to a Bakery (down the Street, you know the one) right after for a real Dessert!  We probably got the most unique Dessert they had from the sounds of the others!  The Deep Fried Bananas with not much more than Sugar and Cinnamon on the outside and a Cream cheese Dip, more than disappointing it was the opposite of good! 1 yelp star seems too Generous!

I came when it first open and I loved the food. The beer I wasn't the biggest fan of but the food was worth the trip. Then I had to leave town for work and when I came back I heard they had Sunday Brunch. I love the brunch. It's a buffet with a choice of one specialty item. Then when it hits noon the alcohol is available. Love the mimosas. The brunch buffet is awesome. I love the grilled pineapple. My favorite of the specialty item would have the hash with egg. Soooooo good. I have been the told the beer is top notch now. I just haven't had a chance to try it. Will be going back to try the beer again.

Cool place liked the drinks loved the flatbreads. I'm not a local, never heard of this place but wanted to try some new things. We told the bar tender what we liked porters/stouts for me wheat for Aubs and we let him order flights for us. The Ruckus imperial stout was delicious, if I lived in the area I would have gotten a growler. They had a limited quantity maple beer which we both liked, it was Aubs's fav tasted like a breakfast beer if there is such a thing, we also enjoyed the out to pasture. The grand optimist and succession were decent. The bar tender picked well for our tastes.  After seeing the flatbreads come out of the oven by the entrance we were compelled to give it a try. The bar tender confirmed that the BBQ duck flatbread and chicken waffle flatbread were great choices. Again he was right. They make their own root beer in house which is then used to make the BBQ sauce. The duck was lean, the flatbread was flavorful. The chicken and waffle flatbread had large cubes of chicken and bite sized pieces of waffle all covered in maple syrup. Aubs liked the sweeter chicken/waffle better, I preferred the savory BBQ duck.  My advice is to sit at the bar, tell them what you like and let them order for you. Sometimes it's nice to be babied at the brewery.

Went to Heist this Sunday for brunch.  I was very excited to take my mom since she's never been and my experience in the past (although it's been over a year) was really excellent.  So, it was very disappointing when we first arrived and were greeted by a very RUDE hostess who obviously woke up on the wrong side of the bed.  After being told that since we didn't have a reservation we would not be able to sit inside, I asked to just please check...well it seems that there was a table available after all as she rolled her eyes.  The brunch itself was set up in the in-between hall with the food displayed without any sings and it was dark (you could hardly tell what each item was).  The waffle bar, which I loved so much last time I was there, was gone; the make to order omelet bar was gone, the mussels were just thrown together in a tray. The entire presentation of food was very disappointing and more importantly the food was not good. It was bland and boring.  Heist brunch is too expensive for it to be anything short of amazing.  And it fell short...very short.  Won't be going back.
Beer has gotten much better. Citra quench is amazing. Wish it was available all the time. Hopefully they can keep it consistent!

I can write an ode to Heist Brewery and their Sunday Brunch. A big projector plays the Sunday NFL games, along with a variety of TVs. With $10 bottomless mimosas and a $16 all you can eat buffet, where can you go wrong? Aside from having traditional breakfast options like biscuits and gravy, eggs, and pancakes, Heist takes it a step further. They offer grilled pizzas, wings, an assortment of desserts, and twists on traditional breakfast options. The Butterfinger French Toast and Rum Soaked Grilled Pineapple are unreal. Stefan the Bartender is a master mixologist. This place is a must go!

I have heard and read so much about this place and finally got the opportunity to try it out this past Saturday.  I am really glad I got the chance.  It has a lot of really good things going for it.  The atmosphere was pretty loud as you would expect on a Saturday evening at a place that serves its own beer.  The design of the place was really cool, casual, and trendy.  I really liked the exposed brick and the light fixtures made of old jars.  We were seated at a table right across from the kitchen so we got to watch the cooks prepare the dishes which was pretty interesting.    The waitress was extremely pleasant but it was easy to tell that she was overwhelmed.  I'm not sure if they were short-staffed on this particular evening or what, but there were long periods of time when we didn't see her.  On a less busy night, she would have been great.  Although all that other stuff was important, the main reasons we came here were the food and the beer.  There were so many creative small plate options on the menu that we really struggled to pick just one.  We went with the chicken and waffles sushi.  I had no idea what this thing was going to look like; but when the plate came out and I saw it, it all made perfect sense.  It was basically five thin waffles wrapped around fried chicken pieces with gravy on top, laying in a pool of syrup.  It was pretty much amazing.  I also ordered the jerk chicken flatbread which was really good as well.  The one thing I will point out with this particular flatbread is that I expected the chicken to be similar to Jamaican jerk chicken with the spicy sauce and whatnot (as the name would suggest), but it was just normal grilled chicken.  Still, it was really good.   And finally, the beer.  There were about ten different types.  I had 5 of them (no I'm not an alcoholic, I ordered a flight which is a 5 beer sampler).  They all were distinct and really good.  The types varied from a porter to a light lager.  Frankly, it's hard to beat fresh-brewed draft beer.  There were also growlers for sale for those interested in taking some home for later.  Ultimately, this is a really good place with a cool atmosphere, unique dishes, and good beer.  I was really happy to try it and will definitely be back!
Not only does this place have a great beer selection, it very well may be the best Sunday brunch in Charlotte.

This is a review for their Sunday buffet.  I'm really torn.  The food was quite good, but there was one overwhelming theme (there were 7 of us and we all agreed).....the food was stone cold.  Seriously.  The waffles were delicious even cold, they are by request so you have to wait for them to be brought out to your table from the kitchen.  You'd think items direct from the kitchen would be hot!  Ditto with the omelettes.  You select your toppings and give the card to the waiter...he brought back one of my dining partners a stone cold omelette.  Wtf?  The buffet itself was really delicious, but NOTHING was hot.  They had most items just on platters - ie, NO chaffing dishes or anything to keep it warm.  Very disappointing.  Highlights:  the rum soaked pineapple and egg rolls.    See why i'm torn?
The brunch buffet is amazing, offering variety of well cooked dishes to choose from.

Cool vibe inside - mostly high tops.  Cozy little patios would be nice in spring and fall for sure.  Lots of TVs and screens for sports.   Beer is delicious.  It is nice that they have food, since most of the breweries in the area do not...But, the food is very heavy.  Everything we ordered was spicy and/or super rich.  Maybe we made the mistake of going to eat for lunch instead of dinner.  It was just a super heavy meal.

Cool spot. Beer is good and food is even better.  Lots of unique options. We had the mini hot dogs, Caesar salad egg rolls and rib fries. Our friends had the beer cheese dip with pretzel sticks. Everyone enjoyed the food and the vibe of the place is great.

Happened upon Heist while exploring NoDa. Decided to try a flight of beer, really good flavors on each of the 5. Food looked delicious as well.   The patio is great for any time of day, with family on a Saturday afternoon or late night with friends.   Highly recommend.

AWESOME aewsome flatbread pizza's! Came here as a stop on the walking foodtour of NoDa and Heist was EASILY my favorite stop of all.  The owner is a young entrepreneur who hails from NH and has a great story to tell. He's a beer lover, good food lover and very passionate about his business. Everyone should love what they do THIS much!   We tried some of their craft beer and house-made soda's - both delicious and unique. But what I loved most were the 3 kinds of flatbread's we got to try.   I was surpsised that as a meat lover, my favorite pizza was actually vegetarian. Kale, cheese and PERFECTLY roasted tomatoes all on top of a crunchy yet hearty crust. OH SO GOOD. They also had a mac and cheese pizza that looked like it was a crowd pleaser.   I would totally come back if I'm back in NC! Just a chill place to hang out with friends, drink some beer, eat some hearty food in a laid back but hip atmosphere.

I went to this place last Sunday for brunch, and of course my favorite thing is the $10 bottomless mimosas special. They have a good brunch buffet, with a variety of food. I ate from baked brie, mushroom quiche (not my favorite, it was cold and didn't taste very good), the pizza flatbread with salmon was delicious, I also liked the cheese grits, eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits, they had some kind of sausage gravy that was good, and I better not forget to mention the amazing chocolate cover strawberries (I love them) and a lot of other things. After all that food, incredibly I still had room to eat some waffles. I like mine with strawberry syrup but they had some other options there. I didn't get to try the omelets, but I will make sure to do so next time. So the food was very good for $15 brunch buffet and the service was also very good. Our waitress was on top of things and very friendly. We didn't have to wait at all for a table but then again we were there a lil early, right before noon. If you find yourself in the NODA area on a Sunday morning, make sure to stop by and stuff your face with a lot of food and don't forget the mimosas =)

Such a disappointment. After researching local brewery restaurants, Heist had the highest reviews of breweries with food served at them vs food trucks outside.   We arrived just after 2pm and we had to order off of a limited menu which include a few appetizers and a handful of flatbread options. We decided to stay because we didn't want to continue searching for another place to have lunch.   I was surprised and underwhelmed by the beer menu options so I decided to stick with water. I did try a sample of my friend's' beers and wasn't very impressed.   I ordered a buffalo chicken flatbread and it took a while to come out. Then my friends' food wasn't served for another 5 minutes so mine became cold while waiting for theirs to be served. The chicken on my flatbread was sparse and the buffalo sauce was not balanced with a ranch or blue cheese dressing so I was drinking my water quickly. The waitress never refilled/replaced the water bottle on our table.   I was still hungry so I ordered the beer cheese pretzels appetizer and the pretzels were tasty. The sauce was okay but not well-balanced.   Everything was overpriced at $12+ other than a veggie flatbread at $10.   I'm giving two stars because the atmosphere seemed cool and the pretzels themselves were well cooked and presented. That said, we will not be rushing back.

First off, I want to say that Heist has an amazing atmosphere and their outdoor area is great for warmer weather. That being said, the food is creative but not outstanding and the service is lackluster.   I loved the tofu and 3 bean burger (some of the only vegan/vegetarian options) and both have been removed from the menu. Today I got the fish tacos and it was a mess. The "taco" was falling apart, covered in sauces and had one large chunk of fish on each one. It was impossible to eat as an actual taco without needing a bib or roll of paper towels. Taste wise? Just okay.   The service has declined over time and starts slow from the moment you walk in the door. The hostesses never seem to know what's going on and take a gazillion years to seat people. The servers always seem to be busy - even if the restaurant is half empty. The bartenders are the only ones I really see hustling to get things done timely.   They do have the craft beer thing going for them and they are the only brewery in NoDa that has a restaurant too. But their beer doesn't compete with NoDa or Birdsong. They do always have a good section but it doesn't appear they've found their winning beer yet. You know, the one they'll be known for and will keep on the menu.    I was disappointed in brunch at Heist, too. The waffles were the best part and that's because of the whipped cream.   I want to LOVE Heist. It has such a good space, creative dishes and isn't a chain but I'm stuck on just liking it. If they put a little more effort into the quality of food and ability for their guests to eat it along with the service, I think they could be a 5 star place - especially as NoDa continues to grow.

Without a doubt, one of the best restaurants and breweries in North Carolina. Heist Brewery has many things to offer including a hipster atmosphere, delicious craft beers, and uniquely concocted meals that are perfect for sharing with friends.

Good beer...I tried a flight, stand outs were the Hefewezien, Dubbel and the Red 7., but to me the true standout is the food. I have never seen such an innovative menu at a brewery. Think years past of Southend Brewery, but improved. I was in the mood for a burger and wings.  I know what your thinking that is not innovative for a brewery in  the least, but that is what I was in the mood for.  Both were very good and definitely the chef had their own spin on each. This is far from bar food. Next time I will try something else, not because they were bad, but  there seems to be so many good options here.

Heist didn't win me and my friends over. Great location, very welcoming interior, but that's where the excitement stopped for us. We felt the food could have been much better and the specialty cocktails were decent. The hostess was great but our server wasn't the best. With so many great bars in the NoDa area I'm not sure I'd be willing to return.
We just discovered by reviewing our credit card statement that our server increased his tip without our knowledge.  I wonder how many others this has happened to?  Burger was good service sucked.

Got here early in time for the beginning of their "Not so small batch" beer release (apparently every Monday) which is awesome since we were able to interact with bartender (BTW Maggie is great! Made us out-of-town visitors feel right at home) and hang out.  Great atmosphere, great beer craftsmanship and service! Well played, Charlotte! When we are in town, we will be back!

Stopped by heist a few times since being in town, it's probably one of the more popular breweries in NoDa and has a really good space.   They have a pretty good brunch menu on Saturday and Sunday, you can either do their buffet or Ã€ la carte. Good selection, and the outdoor patio makes for a good aesthetic.  Despite being a brewery, they also make some of the best craft cocktails in town. Definitely don't let the 'brewery' throw you off, their bartenders can make a mean drink.  Food in general has always been above par ranging from traditional bar foods to a few tasteful twists on classics that always go down well with a brew.  My only fault with heist would be be service. Every time I have been in for food, my waiter has somehow forgotten my food order. I didn't want this to influence my opinion, but once it happened more than once and became a trend it was warranted. More notably, none of my servers attempted to curb my frustration with an apology or discount which is standard practice at most other restaurants.  All in all, I would recommend heist. While their service is at times slow, their product is definitely worth it.

I went here for lunch with a colleague..They have a lunch menu available with an assortment of dishes.I ordered the Carne Asada flatbread.I didn't know what to expect,but it was very tasty.Sometimes when you order steak as a meat topping it can take an extra few chews because of the texture.Not this steak!The quality and texture of the meat was on point and everything went well together.I recommend this dish!

Really good beers, especially the IPAs, a lot better flavor than the first time I was there. All the IPAs are hazy to a degree like a New England. The food is also better. Had a tasty smoked turkey wrap and the side I order was the loaded potato soup but it really should be called a cheese soup with potatoes, very flavorful with onions and bacon. Good dark wood atmosphere. The foods a little pricey for pub grub.

I came to Heist with some friends for afternoon drinks. I should start off by saying that I am not a beer drinker. So I ordered a mule from the cocktail menu, it was good. Definitely less of a ginger taste than most places but I prefer it that way. My friends each ordered beers, one got the peaches and cream which she liked. I can't remember the name of the other beer.   We ordered the pretzels and beer cheese and oh my gosh. It is a must. My coworkers are big fans of pretzels and cheese so we always order it at company happy hours and out of all the pretzels and beer cheese I've eaten lately I have to say this was by far the best.   The atmosphere is very cool. The tables are high tops and pretty close together, but they overlook the brewing facility which adds a nice touch.   Only bad part of my visit was when a waitress walked by and dropped an open container of ranch that splattered all over us and the table behind us and no one even came over to offer us napkins to wipe it up or to apologize.   I am looking forward to coming back and trying more of the food and drink options -- and brunch!

Not bad, but not amazing either.  Pros? -Can sit and watch the beer being made -Lovely duck quesadilla! -Quick service -Plenty of seating  Cons? -Beer was a bit watery -Service could have been more friendly

Love this place so much. Love the bar manager (Stefan!), love the founder (Kurt!), love the beer and love the food. What's not to love?   Single-handedly the best unfiltered double IPA I've ever had, will have, or hope to have. Bless these people for providing a crowler for us of this delicious brew, because I don't live in Charlotte and I knew this beast was gonna tap out in days.  SO GOOD.  All their beer is good. It's creative, well made, interesting, flavorful beer. Fans of good beer, no matter what your flavor preference, will love this beer.  Food is also phenomenal. I loved their flat bread pizzas and late night options, which recently allowed me to avoid a potentially hangry hangover experience.  Gear is also something special. Racerback Ladies Tees in cool colors are the way into my heart, Heist! THANK YOU.  Every single time I come back to Charlotte, I will go here. Heist is amazing, hands-down.

I have been so happy to see Heist turn things around from when they were not producing good beer years ago. Our recent visit during Queens Feast Restaurant Week was not quite five-stars, as we were seated at a two-top that had lots of server/waiter traffic rushing by, but it didn't get in the way of us wanting to come back.  Interestingly enough, it was the focaccia and desserts that stole the show; our main courses were good, just not as memorable. I love their wings and really enjoy their beer, so overall the food gets high marks in my book. As is expected in NoDa, parking was limited on a busy Friday night. I was particualry impressed with the ka kau and brunch junkie beers and the blackberry pickin sour had real bright color and full flavor. Keep it going Heist! I look forward to seeing how popular the new event space is that just opened.
Fantastic Customer Service!!!  We got there too late to eat, but Spencer gave us a quick tour and made us feel at home.  Great beers and fantastic atmosphere.  We will definatley be back!!!!!

Heist has very good beer. The only reason I gave them 2 stars. Went for a double date there over the weekend and the wait was a hour and 20 minutes. So we decided to wait and have a few beers before we were sat. (Wild Bois is my favorite.) We finally got sat and our server was okay. They were pretty busy so we were forgiving for the lengthy periods of not coming to our table. We ordered 4 appetizers to share..they all came out at different times. The wings arrived first and were ice cold. Next we received the fried macaroni and cheese balls but they had no flavor..though the sauce they serve with it on the side was good. 20 minutes later we received the pork belly tacos..the flavor was good but the pork was so dry it made it hard to chew. Lastly we had the edamame, no complaints there, they're pretty tasty! I'll return for a beer or two but definitely not for the food.

Decently done craft brews. Nothing amazing nothing bad. Their flavors are a little over powering and it tastes a little more like a home brew than a brew house. But the atmosphere is great and service friendly and knowledgeable about the beers they serve.

Came here on a  Monday night, it was not busy. I ordered a mixed drink: the raspberry mule and it was delicious!   It was a work outing - for my fiance - so we had a large table.   The beer cheese, was yummy! Its a little on the thicker side, but that did not bother me that much.  The fish tacos were pretty good as well. They use cod, which is good since I do not like tilapia. It had a little spicy to it, but still very good.  We had several flat breads - some I do not even know the name of. One was a Mongolian and it was so gooood. It did have a bit too much sour cream for my liking, but i just took some of it off. They had a bruschetta flatbread as well and it was very good, but had a little too much balsamic drizzle. (Definitely a good veggie option). I had another one, it had a bbq drizzle, i think, but that was very delicious; my favorite of them all.   There was way more food on the table as well - I just did not get a chance to taste them because I was way too full from everything else I ate!!  The food, overall was good for bar food. The place was way bigger than I thought it would be; plenty of tables and even a patio.

fresh beer. met there before walking to neighborhood theater... Fish looked good, ribs tasty.   the Sausage and peroigies was too  SMALL on portion. I ended up eating one of the burger burger burgers of one of our group.

Great little place to go and have a beer and some upscale bar food.  Every time we are home in Charlotte this is one of the breweries we like to stop in at.  Their patio is great in the summer time and they have TVs to watch sports on.  They have some great beers in tap too.  We love supporting locally owned breweries and this is a good one!!

We started out here on an afternoon brewery spree in the NoDa area. They had a pretty cool food menu. You should know, the cheeseburger is actually a cheeseburger flavored pizza on flatbread, despite the server saying this to our several group members that ordered it that was on flatbread, everyone still thought it would be like a panini.  I had the BBQ burger and it was awesome. Tater tots are rosemary and parmesan flavored and were pretty interesting as well. Someone also got the Reuben which I liked as well, but the BBQ burger was the best order on our table.   The beers here are all good, most are fairly light. I liked the dubbel the most, but the hefeweizen and blueberry blonde were also very good. The flights are a good deal here: five 4oz samples for $6 I think. They also make a lot of their own sodas which we were able to sample and they were all great too! They make floats!    The venue was really cool, really open warehouse-sized dining room with lots of TVs and see-through panes into the brewing area. They were brewing when we were in and the whole place smelled really-malty which was cool.    Our server was very helpful and patient with my larger group, with several ordering flights.

Went here for Brunch on Sunday and feel in love. Great atmosphere.  Great Food.  Great service.  I had the Bloody Mary flight, which I found to be very original and interesting.  Also had the small plate of Short Rib Hash - To DIE For! Very Tender beef, perfectly cooked potatoes - really well tasty.  And just the right amount.  The buffet was also set up and they had a lot of variety.  All in all Loved this place.  And will go back.

I've been to Heist three times, all for different meals. The only ~cool~ thing about Heist is the location, the ambiance, the decor, and they have a really nice outdoor seating area. Other than that I would overall just avoid going here, especially considering service has always been a 2/5 going here.   First, DO NOT GO FOR BRUNCH. The deal that they have seems amazing at first, but once you try the food its just...so disappointing. They have an all you can eat hot bar which I would call a lukewarm bar with a random assortment of dishes ranging from mussels to a casserole dish to sandwich meats and muffins. Also included is one item from their brunch menu that all sound great, but might be the worst food I've ever had. Eggs and beans were cold, the tortilla was soggy, yet hard at the same time? My friend got steak and eggs which consisted of two quarter-sized pieces of steak with cold scrambled eggs. I could go on for another two pages about how entertainingly bad this experience was. Also, their bloody mary and their champagne flight are also horrible. Most of the champagne tasted either like perfume or dishwashing soap. They use in-house bloody mary mix which is very watered down and has zero flavor.   Second, I came here for lunch to give them another try. Their menu is just very very fast with items from kimchi to steak and waffle tacos to a large assortment of flatbreads. Most of the items on the menu are overpriced in my opinion. My friends have liked the burgers. I got a caesar salad, that was very small as an entree option which was sad. The dips they have are a-ok. I think they really need to scale back their menu because nothing on it tastes bad, its just that everything tastes mediocre, and is very expensive.   Lastly, I came here most recently for trivia night and it was fantastic. The trivia host really made the night for me. Food wise, I ordered the truffle fries that came with a "not-yo-mama's-ketchup". This is the only thing I would recommend getting without being disappointed. The presentation is nice as the fries come in a little frying basket and the sauce reminded me of a mix of sweet and sour sauce with ketchup and red pepper flakes. The beer selection is alright. None of them have really stood out to me. I would suggest getting the average-joe as it is light and refreshing, and is overall pretty average but not disappointing.   Overall, if you are still not convinced that heist is not worth your money and really really really want to try it for yourself, I would recommend going for lunch and sitting outside. You might have a 2/5 experience at best.

I really like this place for drinks since they not only brew their own beer (which the fella likes), but they also have wine and a full bar for those of us non-beer drinkers.  The food is always creative, inventive and tasty, and the atmosphere is lively, but cozy.    I finally got to try their Sunday brunch buffet ($15), which starts at 11:00 a.m.  Don't be fooled by the 11:30 listing on their website/Facebook page.  When we got there at 10:59, we were about the 20th people in line!  Get there early and be prepared to wait in line for the buffet, but it'll be worth it.  Today's line up was flatbread pizza, fruit compote with brie, sausage, bacon, eggs, Eggs Over Baghdad, muffins, cobblers, oysters, crawfish, an omelet station and a waffle station with just about the best waffle I've ever had.    The brunch is leisurely enough that we were still there at noon when the bartenders rang the bell letting you know it was time for alcohol sales!  The waiters come around a little before noon to take orders so they're delivering the drinks right at noon, which I appreciate.  Our bottomless mimosas ($10) were served in tall, skinny shot glasses, and they really never did stop coming.  If my stomach can ever hold out til 11 a.m. again, this'll be the place I hit!

Hands down THE BEST brunch buffet in Charlotte, in my humble opinion. Eggs, bacon, sausage, ham, potatoes, donuts, biscuits, muffins, fruit, grits, waffles - they've got all your breakfast staples covered. I have yet to try something that isn't muy delicioso. My only disappointment is that my stomach isn't quite big enough (yet!) for me to veg on Heist's patio on a Sunday morning and eat for 4 hours straight.  I can't give a raving review on Heist's brunch "libations" menu, as I've only tried one - the bottomless mimosa. Don't order that. Tastes like orange flavored water. Maybe try the bloody mary instead - I can't vouch for it, but it has to be better than the mimosas. When in doubt, just stick to the buffet!

I had a surprise birthday beer bash here. They were so accommodating to set it up and reserved the entire upstairs "loft" for us. They even allowed me to bring a cake in.  It was our first time here. Our waiter was a little slow initially, maybe he was overwhelmed, but he finally got on. The ball. We ordered several apps - all the flatbreads (bruschetta, cheeseburger, and duck) and the pretzel braids with cheese dip. Unfortunately the food was just ok. I'm not a big beer drinker, but I did enjoy the Blonde Ale I ordered. Several of the guys ordered a flight of beer, which they had to ask for as it wasn't on the menu. Then they could ordered a pint of the one they preferred.   It was a fun party on a beautiful day! As we left, our waiter suggested we return for their brunch. This is actually what my friend said was spectacular, so we will definitely do that! I'd go back and enjoy a beer sometime but probably won't eat other than brunch!

Going to keep this review brief..  We went to Heist on a Thursday night, there was a good size crowd so my boyfriend and I sat at a high top table. We each tried a few beers and they all had great flavor. The food is small plates/tapas style.. Definitely great for sharing. The man and I shared a flatbread made with duck and homemade root beer BBQ sauce, slider trio, and pretzels with beer cheese dip. Everything was delicious, fresh, and made from scratch. Definitely a great place to go with a group since it's open, loud, and almost everything on the menu is shareable!
From out-of-town can't believe how good the food is almost like a five-star restaurant
I love the beer and food here. The systems are correct and I don't have to worry about "do I turn left or right?" Definitely coming back when in north clack-a-lack

This place was just OK.   Love the decor and atmosphere. I live in NYC and it made me feel at home. Service and food were meh. I asked for a taste of a beer and the waitress brought me a whole one, which I didn't really like but now felt obligated to drink. She would also disappear for long periods.    We got the hamburger flatbread, lamb meatballs and apple pie flatbread. Both flatbreads were just bad (how can you screw up apple pie?) but the meatballs were really good.   In short, come here for a fun drink with friends, but don't expect much else.

I've been to Heist on 3 separate occasions, twice for Live Music and once for the Lyft party, and each time I've left unimpressed.  The beer selection is ok, but every beer I've had has been pretty weak and boring.  The service in the dining area was slow and our waitress did not seem very happy to be there.  The back (or front?) bar area with live music this last time was a lot of fun, though, and we had excellent service from the bartender.  The Light Lager was still very bland.

Atmosphere is very relaxed and they had a great late night menu selection. I'd love to come back during normal business hours to try out their full menu. I ordered the steak and potatoes and it was delicious! My friends ordered the beer cheese plate and chicken waffle tacos- both were also very good!

Absolute best burger in Charlotte!  The beer cheese burger!  The burger is only available for lunch......not sure why...maybe we can start a petition to bring that hot slice of awesome to the dinner menu!  I regularly go and get the beer cheese burger and the vegetable soup for lunch...it is freakin awesome!
Although I'm not a big craft beer drinker Heist has a really cool atmosphere-TVs, outdoor seating, and creative food presentations that are good to share!  Great addition to NoDa!

Went to heist for their Sunday brunch buffet and was satisfied with everything.  The brunch buffet was $19 and included in al la carte item, moderately pricey but not crazy, especially for a brunch buffet.  The buffet was pretty decent the pork loin, flat bread being two of the best main dishes in my opinion.  The pork loin was cooked well and not dry at all for being under a heat lamp.  The flat bread where pretty good as well.  The best item on the buffet would be their rum grilled pineapple dessert though!! That was phenomenal!  For my al la crate item I got their spinach, chicken, mozzarella, and artichoke omelette,  that was pretty good as well.  For a beverage, the Pretty and Witty whit beer, I have had better and worse whit beer.    TLDR version: So overall 4 stars, nothing was absolutely amazing but everything was pretty good and I was satisfied with my experience.  I will try again in the future to sample more brews and something besides brunch.
Heist brunch is awesome! Great breakfast buffet filled with bacon ham and sausage. Grits were amazing and awesome add on entree. I'd definitely recommend you trying it out!

Sunday buffet was expensive and a disappointment after all of the great things I've heard and read. There was no price listed for the brunch buffet on the website, but something I read said $16, and at that price we were disappointed. Then when we got our check and it was $19, we wished we had gone to Bistro LA Bon for $20. The food was average and the selection was odd. It's a great looking place with good music, but it was a little too loud and we couldn't hear each other talk.
Just mediocre.  Food is ok but overpriced.  Very limited beer list. Heist beer like their food is ok.  Service is worse.  Don't see a reason to return here

I love the food here. Really love it. It can get a bit pricey for what you get, but I've never been disappointed by the flavor or the uniqueness of the items. My favorite is the seemingly simplistic Cheeseburger flatbread that is shockingly delicious. To me, their beer still leaves a bit to be desired even though they changed it up a while back. My friends said they came away really impressed by the IPA but since I am not a fan of IPAs right now, I could not say. I did not love the American Pale Ale, which they raved about. It was certainly drinkable though. The atmosphere is already great and the addition of the expanded patio really adds to it in making this overall a great place to take a date, dine with friends, or bring some out of town co-workers.

We went here for the third time last night. It was a Wednesday and there was no wait.  We usually have to stand around for 10-15 minutes to get a table, but not last night. Their food is worth the wait, though. I haven't gotten anything I didn't like.  Even our super picky daughter loved the fried chicken waffles.  The beer is excellent and always quick to arrive.  I highly recommend the beer cheese and pretzels because the dip is Amazing.  Also, the burger burger burger is AWESOME.  The flat breads and tacos are equally fabulous!  The parking was a challenge a couple of times.  One night we had to walk quite a distance from our car, but that just made us realize we needed to go during the week instead.  Heist is a wonderful place to eat. The service is great and the food is well worth the hour drive it takes us to get there.

I Love Heist! I am a HUGE fan of tapas. Every meal I have had at Heist has been great. Most recently I had their pork belly tacos which were the best thing ever! I also like their buffalo chicken flat bread and in the winter they have a toasted cheese with tomato soup shot and that is great as well. I think for the small portions you get it's a little too pricey. If they knocked the prices down a little on the tapas I think it would be better. I am not always a fan of their beer offerings. I recently had their summery beer and I liked that, but if there is nothing on the beer menu for me I will just get a cocktail. We had a group of 15 the last time we went and they did an AMAZING job with the service. I will definitely be going back to this place.

I want to like this place so much..but, to me, it is only so-so.   I've been for dinner and for brunch. Brunch is hit-or- miss. Service is always...okay. Beers have consistently disappointed.  Will give it another try or two before fully dismissing it.

Sunday brunch is excellent!  The mimosas are weak, but I do love a bottomless mimosa special.  However, the food buffet completely overshadows this shortcoming.  Pretty pricey brunch bill, but the food is phenomenal.  Muscles, flat bread pizza, grits, quiche, biscuits and gravy, chicken wings.  Great combo of food on the buffet and it's all extremely tasty.  Service could have been better, it was not awful.  I will def go back to this place.  Be prepared to wait, the word is out on how good this place is.  There will be a wait.

This is a brewery located in NODA... Attached to a yummy pizza spot!  It's on the edge but walking distance to the majority of other places in NODA.  I wanted to note that I am basing this review off of our brunch experience, which was enjoyable!  We decided to hit up Sunday brunch to have a nice day date- because it was a nice day!  We chose to sit out on the front deck/patio area, which was a little walk to the food area (it's a buffet) but worth it to enjoy the weather.  So like I said, this was a brunch buffet.
