You also get a menu where you get to choose one a-la-carte item.  I chose Shrimp and Grits, and my husband chose an omelet.  We both enjoyed these items!  The brunch had a variety of options, including juices.  I enjoyed bacon, potatoes, some pizzas, and some other random finds.  They also have a grilled pineapple which I tried- it was good and I guess soaked with alcohol!  A good treat to end your meal.    I really enjoyed our meal- but it was definitely expensive.  We will have to save a place like this for special occasions and celebrations because of the costs.  If it way maybe $5 less I feel like we could swing it more often.  I can't speak for any drinks or beer because we visited when I was pregnant.  But I will have to head back once I'm able to indulge a bit.  If you want a treat of a meal, and money is not an issue though it's mostly breakfast food- check it out!

Love heist, such a great spot for brunch! When I went they were not very good at restocking the buffet though (flatbreads in particular). They seemed to always have a piece or 2 of 1 of the types of flatbreads at a time.

I really enjoyed this place. We went at about lunch time and it was kind of empty, but started to fill up while we were there. Very cool atmosphere, plenty of floor space. One thing I hated was that many of the tables have backless bar seats. Although its a brewery sitting on a backless barstool for a long period of time isn't all that comfortable. I quickly resolved this by switching for a stool that did have a back, but not sure if I could've switched so easily had the place been packed.  The waitress was a little slow (e.g. When bringing the check or getting something we asked for) considering how empty it was but she was so nice that it makes up for it. She really was attentive and took the time to help us decide on what we wanted.   My food was just ok, a little too crisp/crusty for my taste i guess. We had spinach and artichoke with flat bread, BBQ duck pizza and orange soda. The orange soda tasted like orange creamsicle, very good. The waitress told us that all products are made by the brewery. Items that were not made by the brewery were specified on the menu.  The bathroom is another thing that I liked. I felt like I'd stepped into a southwest spa or something, lol. It smelled of fresh wood and the decor was better than the restaurant!
Had a horrible experience at this place. Food took forever and was not good. Then when using the restroom it was absolutely disgusting. I do not recommend.

Sunday brunch is fantastic. Don't load up on the brunch all you can eat items. You also get to order off the menu. The steak and egg is highly recommended. The chicken and mac is great too. Bottomless mimosa- $12.

One of my friends from home moved to the Charlotte area about a year ago and suggested we meet at Heist for a quick dinner and catch-up session. It's one of her preferred local breweries, and she gave an excellent summation of their offerings.  Our server was on point and super friendly. I had a beer in front of me within minutes -- the top-tier Apricot Peach Pickin' -- and we ordered light dinner dishes as well. I selected the taquitos and it was perfectly proportioned to eat solo as a full meal or to share as an app.  The brewery itself is on the larger size, but it's broken into different rooms with two different bars and plenty of tables available. The restrooms are well kept and the parking lot is easy to navigate.  Overall, I enjoyed my snappy visit and would recommend it to others living in -- or visiting -- Charlotte.
I had the beer cheese Burger with Parmesan truffle fries. The burger was a decent burger and very messy. Good beer and bar food especially for a brewery.

I've lived in NoDa for years, and NEVER have I had a good experience at Heist.  The hipster barista wannabes behind the bar will ignore you for 30 minutes.  'Reserved' seating will always sit empty while you stand and wait for a normal table.  The $20 entrees would be appetizers at any other restaurant in Charlotte.  Stick to the pizza joint next door, Heist is terrible.

Dang! I was gonna fight Jared for the first reviewer badge, but we were both beaten.   Finally, Heist is open! The amount of work that has gone into each part of the brewery is unimaginable (to me anyway, who knows nothing about wood or granite work). The space itself is huge and well thought out. There's a bar in the front and another in the back. They serve not just their own beer, but also liquor for those unfortunate gluten free souls. Their menu is pretty great as well, not typical bar food at all. It was opening night, so I'll have to forgive them for not having pretzel sticks for my beer cheese (which was delicious). I heard great things about the chicken and waffles, the bacon wrapped tots, and flat bread. The presentation and aroma of all the dishes that passed by me were impressive. They served the bacon wrapped tots on small slabs of granite and the flat bread on custom carved wood platters.   Most importantly, the beer. I loved the I2PA - hoppy, complex goodness. And the second beer I had was damn good too...I ordered a red, but I swear it was a pale ale because my friend ordered the pale ale and got something that tasted like a red. So, I won out on that (probably) order mistake. In any case, I'll have to come back to be sure.   They'll have brunch offerings in a few weeks so I'll just have to be here all hours of the day.  Also, they played some tracks from my favorite band which I haven't heard played at any other establishment (besides a concert venue). Big props for good tunes.

One of the best brunch spots in Charlotte!!! Had to use a star for parking (or lack there of) but the food makes your mouth water while eating it!!! They stay packed but get you seated quickly. So much food to choose from. I recommend starting with the Pizza Trail, then moving to the fresh foods (fruit and salad), then the buffet line. I recommend EVERYTHING only because the food line up changes often. My fav were the cheese steak sliders, shrimp & grits, and whatever they do to the pineapple is alright with me!!!! Can't wait for summer so i can sit on the patio and sip mimosas while enjoying brunch.
I went with a big group. Drinks are good food was just okay we had almost everything on the menu.

WOW!  Every time I come here I am impressed.  The location is easy to find right on North Davidson and has a huge parking lot that wraps around the side of the building.  The decor is barn wood and industry-chic.  The bar area is spacious and has tables as well as seats at the bar.  The bar itself is stacked with everything in case you are with a non-beer drinking friend.    The beer selection is huge compared to other breweries nearby.  There is something for everyone - I looove the IP2A.  Very smooth and still high ABV.  You can try a flight tho if you aren't sure what you would like.  The food is what really sets this brewery apart.  You can peak into the kitchen off the bar and see the chefs busily preparing orders.  Each menu item comes out of the kitchen as if it were a work of art!  I have personally had several items including various flatbreads and the pretzels with cheese sauce.  All of it fantastic.    The service has always been stellar whether you are in the bar or seated at a table.  There is a small patio out back too all set for summer time.  Love it here!

Finally tried HB last night with friends.  The decor is really cool.  Loved the rustic look of the old brick and wood.   Almost immediately you can tell HB is much more than just a brewery.  Their cocktails are very good and creative.  Kind of odd that I only tied one beer in a brewery, but the ctails looked so amazing that I couldn't resist. As for the food, very impressive.  The menu is extremely creative and works for me.  The hard part was deciding which plates to try as they all look and sound delicious.To combat this we tried over half the menu.  Everything was very good with exception of the pork belly corn dogs (just didn't work for me-too much breading).  I especially loved the lobster bisque test tubes and the cheeseburger flatbread.  Finally, the service was fairly good considering how busy this place was.  Great place for larger groups.

I like Heist. The food is great. The fry basket is outstanding, flat breads are yummy and brunch is amazing. Beers rotate quite a bit and sometimes they run out of one type. They have a great cocktail list and some interesting beer drinks. I have not had bad service any of the 6 or so times I have gone. I have found all the staff to be friendly, often funny and genuine. Check this place out!!

The food was tapas style small plates. We had a group of 8 and the service was great. The drink selection was good with a cocktail menu, wine, and good beer selection. The plates are a bit overpriced. For tapas, I feel like they should have been $8-9/each. These were proved high for the size. Otherwise, good experience. We will go back!

Went here on a food tour and this was one of the best stops. The chef prepared an amazing meal, so I'm sure many of the items on the menu are great. They brew their own beer in house, so there are great options there. They also carry some cocktails on tap which is great for non-beer drinkers. I'd definitely go back to Heist.
Great seasonal menu, awesome cocktails, chill patio with tv's, professional service and good beer.

Loved the atmosphere. Can't beat sitting outside on their deck on a nice day. Good price and selection of beer. Had the cheesy mac flat bread and split with a friend, good snack but nothing too special.

Great food, extremely mediocre beer. The three stars is a reflection of the food.  If I were rating the beer alone, I would have rated 1-2 star, and if on the food alone, 4-5 stars.  We sampled quite a few dishes:  The chicken&waffle sushi, the forked up tuna, the pork belly corn dogs, the torched diablos, and the jerk mango chipotle wings.  All of the dishes were excellent and beautifully presented.  The forked-up tuna was the star of these in my opinion.  The beer on the other hand was very uninspired.  I tried a flight of 5 beers (stout, brown porter, red, pale ale and the maibock) plus a pint of the Hefeweizen.  All were very bland, flat and lacked flavor across the board.  I would rate the brown porter as the best of the worst, but I would not recommend any of them.    Service was very friendly and attentive.  Shame the beer was the lone negative point.

Loving Heist.  They have it all.  They have a great menu and an awesome bar.  Then when you think you've seen it all, they have a huge brewery taproom.  #WhatWhat  Love this place.  We stopped in after a mother's day brunch.  Great servers and service.  Stephan, the man behind the bar, knew his stuff.  And, he was all about talking up the goodness of Heist Brews.    We thought we were coming in for a quicky drink, but we stayed and ate a wood fired pizza. #GoodTimes.   I enjoy the beers and the Bacon and Cheese Flatbread wood fired pizza is the stuff of legend.    I live the parking, bathrooms rock.  The price is decent.  The pizza was a bit small for $12 but after $3.75 Drafts, I'm golden.    Great service from Sky and Stefan

Heist - everyone knows about Heist - fancy food and decent beer - that's the general feel I get from talking to others who have been there. As with most Charlotte Breweries, I have already tasted their beer prior to my visit. This was my last brewery in Charlotte that needed an "official visit".  The Brewery Restaurant complex that is Heist, is quite extensive. A large patio/outdoor seating, two bars and a main indoor dining area. My initial impression was that it felt very dark and cave like in here. There was a private party in one area, so we sat at the bar by the brewing tanks.  As I've already tried the majority of their beer, I settled on the closest thing they have to an IPA which is their San Fran Disco, a hoppy American Ale - it was drinkable and refreshing but nothing spectacular.   Our bartender was not friendly at all - she was "short" with us and didn't really seem like she felt being at work. She was all business and wanted to get the "job" done and move on. When I asked questions, she answered so quickly, it felt like she couldn't be bothered.  While sitting at the bar another server/bartender (?), tall and blonde, helped an AA family waiting for their table with drinks; the server was really very rude to them. Yes, they ordered 4 Sprites but that shouldn't matter. She filled them all with the soda hose, dripping soda everywhere and almost slammed them on the bar. "Here you are, four Sprites!" she sneered. I couldn't believe the family didn't say anything - I certainly would have and almost did on their behalf. So A) the server was having a bad day and took it out on the customers B) she is rude all the time and shouldn't be a server C) she felt like the customers were being cheap and refer back to A or B - D) she doesn't respect people of other colors. The whole "sour" staff ruined the experience for me. Maybe it was "bring your personal baggage to work day". I don't care if your beer and food is just okay or awesome. If your staff doesn't represent your product well, no one will buy it.  All the pictures I've ever seen of their food look awesome. I would probably be more likely to come back here for dinner than for the beer next time.  Going to round up to 3 stars as I try not to be "that guy who's trying to wreck a business". The staff members I encountered were 2 star and 1 star.

The only heist here is what happens to your wallet.   01 // The "beer" is watered down.  02 // This place is more a restaurant than brewery. Not my kind of restaurant at that. Go somewhere else first.  03 // Expect high prices and little portions of food.  04 // You can't just "sit at the bar." They want to serve you at a table like a restaurant.

Ignore all of the old reviews of Heist that you might come across. They are woefully inaccurate. SInce finding a new brewmaster and chef a while back, Heist has become a force to reckon with in the Charlotte beer scene.   If you're a fan of IPAs, Heist easily has the best in Charlotte. Their New England, cloudy, citrusy IPAs put all others in the Charlotte area to shame. It's not just IPAs either. Heist makes great beer all around, and there's usually a wide enough variety on tap to satisfy any beer drinker. In addition to all of the great beers, Heist has some great cocktails and an excellent selection of spirits.   The food at Heist is also fantastic. They do small plates, and I haven't had anything that wasn't excellent. I love the beer cheese (actual beer cheese...not a runny cup of sadness like you'll find at certain other breweries) and flatbreads in particular.   To top things off, the service is always superb. From the host or hostess to the waitstaff and bartenders, all of the Heist employees I've met have been friendly, attentive, and knowledgable. If you're worried about finding a spot, they'll take reservations.   If it's been over a year since you've been to Heist, you really need to go back!

THE BEST BRUNCH... if I had to choose where to go to brunch everyday, I would choose Heist. Cost may be a bit high but is 100% worth the fresh and hot buffet they offer. The brunch menu is excellent and food is delicious.

Good beers and bites.  We were In town for the Belk Bowl and this was the only brewery open at 11:30 since all the others did not open until 4 and the game started at 5:30. We ordered the flatbread with basil on it and asked if they could put fresh basil and to my surprise the flat bread came out covered in fresh greens. It was good. We also tried the wings and they were ginormous. I tried a cocktail and that too was good. If this place had been closer to the stadium we probably would've gone here to tailgate but it's on the other side of town it seems from our drive.

Food is great here - love the smoked wings. For some reason they cannot get the service part right. I've been here 3x and all 3x service has been an issue.  Takes forever to get anyone to wait on you or have food delivered to the table.
Went today for the first time for Sunday brunch, loved the buffet and quick service! Great vibes.

Everyone raved about this place before I tried it myself. I liked the atmosphere very much. The drinks were great! The pear martini was SO good!  The food on the other hand was just ok. I like the totchoes (sp) a lot. They were very interesting and quite delicious.  The pretzels with beer cheese was was just okay. We also ordered the chicken wing - and it was also just okay. The pizza flatbread was pretty good but nothing to rave about.
I was expecting more of a brewery. This is more of a causal eatery with beer.. I would come back but it wouldn't be on my "brewery" list..

4 stars based on the service and atmosphere.  I absolutely love the interior of this place.  Very shaby chic and trendy at the same time.  We popped in for a quick beer the other night and this place was completely packed out!  That's a good sign.    I tried the local IPA brewed there and while it was completely drinkable I wasn't overly in love with it.  Maybe that will grow on me.  The food being delivered to the tables around us looked great and for that reason alone I will have to go back and give the food a go!

I've been to the Heist Brewery three times now and have brought others from Chicago.  Everyone liked the place- but they liked it for the food.  I think the food is good.  My wife and I like the wings and the tater tots.  I could seriously eat about 30 in one sitting if I were allowed.  The tots are really good.  I've had nearly everything on the appetizer menu and have been thrilled with almost all of it.  The beer, well for a brewery, the beer just isn't all that great.  I've tried a couple of flights of beers on different trips.  Both have been disappointments.  I drink it because I'm at a brewery, so its what you're supposed to do but they aren't all that good.  The Heist offers sodas that they brew as well.  My wife tried the orange soda- average at best.  The atmosphere is cool though and each time.  The service has been great each time as well.  I'm happy with the food.  I'm disappointed with the lack of flavor in the beer.  Its a neat place though in a cool neighborhood.

I tried Heist after reading a review/article in Elevate Magazine and it didn't disappoint!    My first thought when I walked inside was "WOW, this place is beautiful!" The wood-lined walls are rich and inviting and yet, laid-back.  The vats located behind the clear glass is strangely comforting, as they are beautiful to look at (who doesn't love giant copper beer vats?) and cool to know that you will be drinking a local made brew.    The food was unique and tasty, but really the beer was what I keep coming back for.  I know it sounds especially girly (yes, I'm a girl, but I'm usually a fan of pale ales and IPA's), but I loved their seasonal Strawberry Ale.  It wasn't as heavy as a lambic, but refreshing and just a hint of fruit.  Not sweet-just refreshed my palate and led me to drink another....And another :-)

Genuinely surprised at all the good reviews on here, after telling friends and fam about my verbal review I wanted to make it official on Yelp. The beer was awful, I had been told by many people on the beer culture of Charlotte that it was but I had to find out for myself. I have a deep rooted love for Noda Brewery, Birdsong and a high respect for Triple C and Old Meck, and Heist's beer makes our town's brewers look bad. Food was good, tasty, and impressive, but I got only four of the Parmesan Garlic Tator Tots. Note to owners, no one who orders Tots wants only four, regardless of quality. I rarely write negative reviews, so here is more good: service, top notch. Decor, lovely. Sorry, back to negative: pricey, a bit pretentious and how do you screw up a red ale? I'm a homebrewer, that style might as well be training wheels! I'd go back if I were with work people who didnt like beer and were paying for the food. Otherwise, I'm getting a better burger at Jack Beagles down the street with a better beer to boot, then going to Noda brewery for the real draft.

I like the place but it's not a place I would frequent often because I like my go-to bars to be a little less pricey.  FOOD: I felt like although they were going for the whole tapas type of food vibe, the portions were pretty small for the price. On another note, I do think it's a nice place for a casual date because the food presentation is just beautiful. My favorite are the flat breads! YUM!  SERVICE: No complaints, very friendly and fast!

Pros:  cool building, nice view of the brewing equipment  Cons:  beer is mediocre at best.. Tastes watered down, food is way overpriced, and the shrimp mousse appetizer thing is horrendous... I mean disgusting.  The chefs creations remind me of the crap I see on Gordon Ramsays kitchen nightmares where the chef gets excited with weird flavor combinations that don't jive... Plus bizarre glasses and food holders that are just annoying.    I will not return.  There's no value here.

Pretty cool restaurant. They had a small parking lot with tiny spaces lol so if you have a big car you literally won't fit. So I came in for brunch on a Sunday and this review is only based on the brunch. The staff were patient and flexible meet our needs. We had a large party of 8. They sat us in the middle area but there were several seating options - small room in the back more intimate, outside which is nice on a beautiful, and or a front area. There was an upstairs location but I don't think it was open during brunch. They had several televisions and even sold clothes with the restaurant/ brewery name. The food was good where jt was buffet style with several different areas where the food was located. The food hit the spot. It wasn't the best food o have ever tasted but it worked well after a long night. The brunch has an a la cart item you can choose from and it was delivered in addition to your buffet plate. I got the shrimp and grits which was basically the same grits and shrimp from the buffet section put together. The mimosa pitcher was a nice.  The restrooms were clean. The server was able to ring us up separately. The server did forget a few items, and we had to ask a few times but it may have been due to the busy time that we were there. He was nice and tried really hard. This place has an urban electric feel that I really enjoyed and appreciate. It was different and charlotte needs different. Overall I enjoyed the people I was with and my time there. I am interested to see what it would be like in the evening or on a week day. So far so good.
Delicous tap beers. Staff is frindly and fast. If your in the area you definetly need to stop by and check it out. Ordered their bbq burger and it was absoltely delicious

This place lives up to the Facebook hype they've been building over the last few months before opening. The beer was impressive not for being "out-there," but for being solid and well-crafted. It's like they are trying to get it "right" before they get fancy. I had a pale ale and it was excellent. My wife's hefeweizen was also good. While the beers were solid and a bit conservative, the food is crazy and complex. The beer cheese had a lot of tastes going on. I was happy it came with a little spoon that I used to scrape the last of the cheese from the bowl after the pretzels were gone. The chicken and waffles were simply indescribable. They come like little sushi rolls and I scarfed them down.  I'll just say "horseradish maple syrup" and leave it at that. The presentation was also a plus. We ended up spending a lot of time watching everyone else's food arrive on wooden carving boards and chunks of marble.  Is it a little pricey? Yes, but I've paid much more for less tasty food in a worse atmosphere. Well done Heist. I'll be back

I went to Heist for dinner and beer a few months ago.  I really wanted to be a fan of Heist since it is in my hood, but dinner was nothing special.  In fact, it wasn't good.  The food left a lot to be desired, and the beer was just gross.  HOWEVER....the brunch here is AMAZING!! The food is so unique and flavorful.  It's buffet style, and there are lots of options to include a waffle bar.  I've been three times, and usually I don't even eat any other meal during the day after this super satisfying feast.  The coffee is ok.  I had to drink my coffee out of a beer glass which was kind of weird but the coffee still made it to the party.

I want to start out by saying that I consider myself to be a bit of a brunch aficionado. I love a good brunch spot and I've been to them all. I was so excited to check out Heist because I had heard good things. First of all, brunch is $19.99 per person. Yikes!  Pretty spendy, but I thought it must be great to make them charge so much. Wrong. The food is cold and under seasoned. I don't know if they ran out of salt and pepper in the kitchen, but everything was terribly bland: eggs, mac and cheese, quiche, salad, etc.  Even the waffles, which you have to order from the waiter arrived cold. This place is not worth the money and with so many amazing brunch spots competing for your business in Charlotte, go ahead and skip this one. You're not missing anything.

We showed up for Sunday brunch with a party of 14 and 4 kids under the age the age of two. The front desk called in Spencer and he made it happen for us with out any wait. They put us in the back room near the stage which was perfect for the kids to play on for a few minutes.  Travis gave us amazing service and never batted an eye at the chaos we brought into the place. Oh yeah, not to mention that the food was unreal and the bloody mary's and mimosas ( that we drank before noon on a Sunday ) were top notch. We got the personal service that lacks most chains and other establishments and that makes all the difference. Thanks again and we will 100% be back again soon.

This is one of my favorite breweries in town.  Their beer selection is good and their food is amazing.  They have a run club on Monday nights at 6 pm.  They're a great group of people!  Definitely, check out this brewery.

Love love love Heist. Amazing beer- one of the only places I've seen do a perfect small batch of strawberry beer. The small plates are killer and I adore the goat cheese they put in those decorative tubes. I think this brewery is a must visit even if you don't drink beer!

I wasn't quite sure what to expect going to this brewery, maybe just typical pub food. But after looking at the menu and the drink menu, I knew Heist was far from typical. I mean come on, has you ever seen a Brewery that makes Beer Cocktails, because I haven't. I will say though that I was a fan not only of the beer cocktail I tried, but also their cocktail as well, the Asian Pear was delicious! The only downside is that I couldn't afford to try more cocktails :(  The menu was very diverse and interesting, but as soon as I saw Lobster Mac and Cheese I had to try it! It was delicious. We also got the Southern Comfort Chicken that was served in a mason jar, both delicious and cute! Finally we tried the salmon belly tacos, which were very tasty. All in all a very great meal! I will definitely be returning as there were many other things I wanted to try. However, my next stop will be for brunch, which sounds amazing!

We're glad to have you, Heist! Anything making this city start to compete with our beloved neighbor, Ashvegas, I am totally for.  I don't know  how your food is and look forward to trying it, but I did meander in a few months ago and have some brews and they were OK. Perhaps I thought based on your awesome interior, decor, and easy parking that you were going to be like NoDa Brewing but even better. But I think this is a case of you focusing on too much to do anything super great.   Beer and food - a beautiful relationship, no? But each needs to be an individual. And even beers, while so related, need to stand on their own, but on my flight there was only a red ale that stood out. The others tasted like the same base week with a drop of flavoring in them. 3 beers with fruit? Come on, I can barely drink OJ so I'm not trying to have Peach in my Hefeweizen. 9 total beers to choose from? Why don't you just try 3 and make them amazing and have 1 additional as a trial batch? Seems like you could really make something great if you focused and whittled down your variety!  As I said, looking forward to trying the food. Perhaps the brews will have totally changed in the 2 months since I've been too? I hope so!

For the big 1000th review, I have to review Heist Brewery, a fairly new brewery in a place called NoDa (North Davidson) that I visited last week. My friend's loft is steps away from HB, and it is definitley a good and bad thing. Great since you can go anytime, have a great time, and walk back home, bad, I would definitley spend way too much money and pack on a ton of calories at this place!  Thursday evening, we had a table right next to the bar, so very convenient. It was a special night, as they were unveiling the beer tap handles. Professional photos were being taken, some delicious hor dourves available, and felt like I was in a monumental moment as people were purchasing glasses of beer as people cheered on.   This place is a lot larger than I had expected, as there's a huge area beyond the front bar. There, you can see the brewery through glass, and it's a large open space of tables and bar tables.  I was introduced to the Moscow Mule, a Russian version of a margarita. It's also poured in these copper (or silver) mugs that keep the drink extra cold the entire time. It was AMAZING! Very addicting, as it's not super strong. The ginger beer was refreshing, especially with the lime provided. I could've drank these all night, and only $9!  We shared a bunch of appetizers, which they have a lot of unique combinations plus your typical bar fare with a twist (strawberry bun anyone?). My favorite by far, was my local friends' favorites as well, the 6 cheese pimento and sherried crab dip. Delicious, especially with the parmesean flatbread provided! I could not stop eating it! Their spinach and artichoke dip was just as good as well! I ordered the jerked chicken flatbread pizza, which was good, but I'd have to say the root beer BBQ duck pizza was even better! We also got the forked-up ahi, which also came with a wasabi soy mist in a mini bottle! How clever is that?   Great ambience of locals dining and drinking, and definitley had a great night here that ended my trip quite nicely. Would definitley recommend this place and feel like one of the locals in the trendy NoDa area!

My decent Sunday brunch was overshadowed by the EXTREMELY unfriendly hostess (petite brunette woman) who was SO rude I had to tell "you should be friendlier to your guests". Good food, rude worker ruined the experience though.

Visiting family near Charlotte. I am an avid taproom / brewpub visitor. Favourite thing to do when going to a new city. I was excited to try out Heist in NoDa (which I had no idea what NoDa was but it is a cute area).  I really wanted to give 5 stars :(  I'll start with the worst and end with the best.  Food: I ordered the Cheddar Bacon Burger with the Parmesan Truffle Fries. Can't go wrong with a burger and beer right? Well..... The burger was rather bland. Kind of disappointing. Also, there was no bottom bunk! I searched and searched. Told the waiter and he went to find out what happened. "They were running out of buns..." What?? Let someone know about that before hand, don't just bring someone a burger with one bun on top and call it a day! I mean, really?? The fried tasted like they were just popped out of the freezer. Nothing special about them at all and did not taste fresh whatsoever. Definitely would not come back for the food.  Beer: I only had the opportunity to try one and I tried Brockwell. It definitely had some character. But to me it wasn't very smooth, almost acidic tasting. Roasted is in the description and that is definitely true- you get a roasted flavour to it. (Not saying that is bad, I actually like a good roast so they were spot on). Was this my favorite? No. I would try something else if ever I get the chance to go back to Heist.  Now the best parts!  Building: I love the inside. It is spacious with upstairs and downstairs seating and HUGE open space that is still cozy and community-like.  Service: Our waiter was very nice and attentive. We let him know we were in a hurry (had to get the dogs from the groomers before they closed ) and he had our orders out so quickly! Additionally, he was very transparent with what happened with my burger. I appreciated that and it didn't go unnoticed.  Would I return? Yes. But only to try a different beer, the ambiance and for the friendly service.

What an unpleasant experience...Birdsong not open yet so I came across this place...totally uninterested and surly barmaids, obviously not interested in serving a new customer....one tells me the beers, I ask for a sample, she walks off...another serves the sample, I order a pint for me and my friend from Texas, she tells me she can't serve me two beers at once per state law...I take my beer outside to the table and then return for his beer...what BS...start a tab? Nope, we finished those subpar beers and left...needless to say no tip and won't be back...apparently you have enough patrons who aren't treated this way or put up with it...on to Divine Barrel for a   5 star experience...Heist is aptly named; glad to see others have also had a bad experience here so it's not just me...hey Heist: without customers you don't exist. Plenty of great breweries in CLT, you ain't one of them.

I've been here plenty of times, but I've never written a review.  I'm never disappointed with their beer or liquor selection.  This brewery is my favorite one in all of Charlotte.  I'm not too sure about the quality of the wait staff because I only sit at the bar where a certain bartender is working.  He's was there the very first time I visited this brewery (few years ago) and he's still there.  Stefan knows how and when the time is appropriate to entertain patrons.    The only reason why I gave this place 4 stars instead of 5 stars is because I wasn't gung-ho about their food.  To be fair, it may not have been my style.  Other people I've been with seem to love it, but not I.

Charlotte is a hell of a beer city, and as of today there's more than two dozen mini breweries in Charlotte. Personally, I like this brewpub more than any of the ones I've been to.  And here's a recipe for a perfect Sunday funday: After your extra hour of sleep (it's Sunday, after all), come here for the most ~magical~ meal of the week and enjoy delicious brunch buffet with friends.   As of now, Heist offer great booze and great food. Later, they'll open a butcher shop, bake shop, and an event shop. Try the duck confit flatbread and few of their seasonal beer rotations. Pizza and beer: great combo. That's why Heist has became one of my go-to spots.   Addition notes: Yoga: Monday6pm for $10 with Free beer.  Sunday brunch buffet ($19): - All-you-can-eat options. - Rotating a la carte menu. - Waffle station. - $5 bloody marys or $12 mimosa carafes.   Keep in mind that Heist don't take reservation.  Five Yelps.

Great location. Good food.  TERRIBLE service.  Been here twice and both times staff standing around and  nobody being helped.  Sat for 8 min without anyone coming to table    Ordered beer that came from back even though sitting 3 ft from bar with bartender doing nothing.  App came same time as food.   28 minutes to get an app!  Seriously.  Also, they don't serve fries.  They have homemade tots which were interesting but undone.

I give four stars for combined atmosphere and food. Very laid back flow, space for sitting outside with pets or your favorite people  Standing ovation style at the bar is another option. We opted for table seating inside with the cool view of the brew machines which was pretty cool.  Shared plates concept is the flow for food, portions perfect for a group of four. We tried the Duck Confit Salad, Pork Belly Tacos, and the Burger Burger Burger Sliders. Salad and burgers were very tasty and well put together. The Pork tacos needed more flavor. Finished off the meal with the Bread Pudding with Jack Daniels sauce. Yeah sounds good but taste and execution not that great. Sliced pieces of bread with sauce lightly drizzled over. Had to ask for extra sauce to help the rather dry pudding representation. Plan to visit again to try other interesting menu items. Hive 5 Beer was delicious

I wanted to like this place.  Went on a Wednesday night in summer, around 8 for dinner.  Just three of us. We walked in to ask for a seat on the deck, was told 'no problem, just sit anywhere'.  So we did.   10 minutes later the server arrives. 3 beers and a water. About 10 minutes later for the beers. Another 10 minutes for the water, which I found extremely odd as you don't need to wait for the bar staff to pour a glass of water.   Finally get our order in about 30 minutes after being seated.   My table mates finished their beers but no sign of our waitress. After about 20 minutes from when we gave our order, my friend gets up to search out some beverages. While inside he finds our waitress who tells him that they ran out of one of the entrees we ordered. 20 minutes AFTER we ordered.   To recap till just now: we've been there for close to an hour, have been served one beverage and had to seek out the waitress to find out they were out of something we ordered 20 minutes ago.   The waitress very half heartedly apologizes and says she'll ask the kitchen to rush a second burger. Rushing the cooking of meat is not something I'd usually hear a restaurant say they'd do.   Another 10-15 minutes for the first two entrees to be brought out. Another 10 for the last one.   To their credit the burger was good. The rosemary tater tots were fried in too low heat, they were greasy, not crispy.   But I can't get over the terrible service and will not be back. There are too many good restaurants in Charlotte and especially in NoDa to settle on this level of service.  It shouldn't take two hours plus hours for burgers and beers.  Tip to the server: don't keep your patrons waiting for beer and be upfront on what's been sold out (it should not take 20 minutes for that info to reach the customer!). Not being proactive on either account is just unprofessional.

A friend decided to try Heist for a brunch get together. I was not familiar with their brunch set up and imagined a typical brunch menu. We were told we could eat at the buffet and order one entrÃ©e from their brunch menu. It wasn't until I started reading the reviews on Yelp that I even knew they had an omelet and waffle station... Our waitress seemed to have a slight attitude ... she didn't notify us, well at least my section of the table (there were around 12 of us )  of additional stations. When our table asked for clarification of entrees  on the menu she had even more of an attitude. I can't find the brunch menu online so I will do my best to describe my entree. It was a layer of French fires, a short rib, egg and then white bbq sauce layered in a bowl. It wasn't clear that this would all come in one bowl and essentially mixed together so when I read the description of the fried egg I asked to have it scrambled. The waitress then told me she can't guarantee that they can scrambled it ... to which I asked her if she could go ask .. instead of telling me she can't guarantee it.  My friends ordered Mimosa's and felt as if they weren't coming frequently enough for the price. Another friend ordered an entrÃ©e without pork and then even asked the server when he dropped it off if it had pork twice and he said no ... the dish had pork in it. Another friend waited almost 30 mins to receive her food. That was her last straw with the service we received so we asked to speak to manager. Everybody in our party which included around 12 people received half off our bill. Now granted we were a large party and some people came in almost 30 mins after our original start time , I think that the service could have been better. I'm glad that the manager rectified the situation , but I don't know if I would go back from brunch.   On a positive note the buffet was pretty good but it would have been nice to know that I could have gotten an omelet and waffle. I would like to try their lunch menu that looks way more appetizing than what I had for brunch.

For 19 dollars you get cold food. The al la cart food was a joke. The shrimp and grits can in a small cup 1/3 filled with undercooked grits and no shrimp. The Benny was a sunny side up get on a Texas toast that was burned. Don't know where the hollandaise sauce went. The pizzas are dried out and cold. My first cup of coffee was cold and probably made the night before. Quality control personnel went by n vacation. Worst food ever. Not worth even a dollar, and they charged us 19. What a joke.

Different type of atmosphere and layout, but I like it. I met a friend here to watch the Panthers game.  Our table was a bit out in "no man's land," and it felt a bit isolated, but I like the place.  I had the veggie burger that came on a bed of warm kale and some other veggies.  All in all, not bad.  The wait staff was good as well and even though it was game night, we got a table pretty quickly.  Good food.  Good company.  And NoDa.  You can't really go wrong with that.

This is a restaurant that also makes beer not a brewery that serves food. First impression was a very industrial look. We went on a Sunday after brunch so the menu was not all available due to the change over from brunch. No big deal we got a flat bread and some beer cheese dip. Both were very good and plenty for two people. Our waitress was very attentive and nice.  On to the beer, we both got a flight to try as many of the beers as we could. We have been to all the other breweries in town and were hopeful this would measure up to those. Not even close! All of the beers tasted like they had been watered down. This place has been around a year give or take a few months so I would think they would have  a few beers coming out perfect by now. But that is not the case, the hefeweizen was light with hardly any banana, the peach hefe was the same but with a hint of peach. The stout was ok but again weak in flavor. The double iPa was more like a regular iPa usually a double will be a little sweeter than an iPa but with a malt flavor not just hops. The amber tasted like water I think it might of just been water and red food coloring. So after the beer I would say go for the food but just skip the beer.
They put way too much ice in their cocktails...$11 for a drink and the ice was filled to the top in one drink and crushed ice in the other. I bet I had about 5 sips of actual drink...

This place is awesome! The inside is decorated with the coolest artwork and the setup is very cool. I sat at the bar and Stephan, the bar manager, was fantastic. I just came in to have a couple cocktails so I can't say anything about the food. I tried three drinks   Pecan smoked whiskey: They set wood chips on fire and let the glass trap the smoke! It's so freaking manly and cool! I prefer my drinks less strong though so I give it a 3/5.   Ginger Whiskey sour: eh. I ordered it because I thought it was going to taste like ginger. It didn't really though.   Burning Leaves: Best drink hands down I had in Charlotte. Totally recommend it. 5/5  I will definitely come back when I'm in town.

NoDa is famed in the Charlotte area for its local dives and great restaurants + brewery's.   The atmosphere in this place is something run-down and beautiful, there is character and charm, like the rest of NoDa. Vaulted ceilings make the place seem more open airy, and the brick walls add more warmth.   As for the food, excellent, we came in on an off time  (3pm) and it came out fast.  We ordered 3x appetizers, wings, duck confit flatbread, and a spinach artichoke dip. All were extremely good and not over seasoned like my fear of most restaurants.   Everything about this review seems great.   Except for the service. Like stated above- this was an off time for the brewery.  Being a manager at a restaurant, I understand understaffing during off hours- and what not. In total number of customers, there were 9 people in the house.  I waited 15 minutes to be seated.  Tables were left dirty.  Waited another 10 minutes to have water brought to my table.  Then another 15 for my waitress to come and take my order. (At this point the waitress saw me take my keys and I was about to leave, and she just so happened to serve me)   40 minutes to place my order at 3pm.  My father who took me here said this has never happened before. And he was appalled at how terrible this was.   I'll come back again, and update this review- because I believe in the food and the beer was great. I was just so disappointed with the service, I'll come back with in a month.

I am such a fan of this place! Why? Because it's a brewery, and I'm not a big beer drinker! The food here is awesome! We visited on a Friday evening around 7. The place was practically empty on the inside. The patio is where the action is. However, it started to fill in quite quickly as we got into our meal. I had the Burger Burger Burger...awesome! The goat cheese paired with their tangy sauce makes it a hit. The wife had the Duck Confit flatbread. It was great! The wife had a flight of bourbon whisky which was really good. The service was top notch. Our waiter was very attentive. Everyone was so professional. I'd definitely go back again!

I got the flight of beers. I really liked 4, less than liked one but all and all it was a success. My favorite was definitely the pumpkin, not so much of a pumpkin flavor but more of a spice :) service was quick and nice!

On Memorial Day stopped into Heist Brewery for lunch and some beers. For food we ordered the Beer Cheese and the BBQ Burger, and for drinks we made our way through two Flights.  Quality Heist Brewery is a unique place, because despite being a brewery, that doesn't seem to define their identity. They feel like a full service restaurant and pub that also happens to brew up some beers. We easily were able to try the ten beers on draft, two of which were guest taps. On this afternoon it was "Hive" Fives, Blurred Is The Word, Room For Activities, Not From Concentrate, Now Trending Blackberry Pick'n, Uberquench'l, Average Joe, and then the two guest choices Good Road Blue Byway and Deep River 4042. Despite being a small selection, each beer I tried was solid. My favorite would have to be Not From Concentrate, a delicious hazy IPA with a wonderful fruit flavor. I also was partial to Blurred Is The Word, another fun IPA. And while I didn't dislike any beers, my least favorite was Blackberry Pick'n, a wheat beer that was extremely tart. Along with the beers we also took advantage of the kitchen, first with the Beer Cheese. It is a bowl of cheesy deliciousness that is paired up with some pretzels. The cheese itself uses beer along with white cheddar, cream cheese, and a mozzarella provolone blend. Excellent, as long as you have some calories to spare. We also ordered the BBQ Burger, which was just alright. The patty itself was great with a mix of brisket, porterhouse tail, and chuck, but for some reason the rest of the toppings, bacon jam, goat cheese, arugula, tomatoes, and bbq sauce did not work for me.  Quantity Flights came with five samples, which was a little annoying since they only had ten beers total on tap, of which only eight were their beers. For food the Beer Cheese is heavy and filling, definitely a dish to share amongst a group. The burger was on the smaller size, but with the side of fries it is more than enough for lunch.  Value I believe the flights cost $7 or $8, which is a solid price for five samplers. The lunch menu was also very affordable, with nothing on the menu listed for more than $14.  Ambiance Heist Brewery is found in the NoDa area a little north of Charlotte. The space itself is massive and if not for the displayed tanks in the back room could easily be confused for any other bar. In front of the building they have a good sized outdoor patio with several tables and picnic benches. The inside space is split into three areas. The main door opens up into the first large dining area. This room is defined by its massive bar displaying not only the beer tap, but hundreds of liquor bottles. We were seated in the other large room that is further back. Here the highlight is the views of the beer tanks and the massive screens on the wall. They have multiple screens throughout the space making it a good place to watch a game. The brewery also has an upstairs area, which I assume is for private parties. I do want to highlight that I loved the music selection. The perfect mix of electronic, rock, and dance songs to keep your head bobbing at all times.  Crowd Being that we had a flight to catch in the early afternoon, we were some of the first to arrive at the brewery. However, around noon a solid lunch crowd had begun to form. And while coffee and mimosas seemed like the more popular choice, we were far from the only ones grabbing an early beer. I would imagine that on weekend afternoons and evenings, as well as happy hour, that this place really fills up.  Service Our server was friendly, but clearly was hit hard by the holiday weekend. She needed several reminders for things we asked for, as the coffee didn't have her going at full steam yet. But they had plenty of other servers in tow, presumably expecting a holiday weekend crowd, who helped lighten the load.   Parking We did not have a car during our visit so we did not have to deal with parking. However, it appeared they had a small private lot, but one unlikely to be able to handle the crowd on a busy day.  Extra Heist Brewery is definitely more than just a brewery. While they brew some solid beers, though I wish they had a few more, they also have quality food and a fun space to brunch or watch a game. Clearly a hangout spot, which I'm sure fills up fast after work and on weekend afternoons and evenings.

Add this to the list of places whose menu descriptions sound way better than what actually shows up. They're in the club with Cowfish and Bebo's. Every single small plate sounds like it's going to be the best thing you've ever eaten.   On our most recent visit, we ordered Steak'N'Taters (marinated flank steak! truffled parmesan! potato cracklins! red wine demi glaze!), Chicken Waffle Tacos (sriracha chicken! hot sauce butter! maple syrup!), and Sweet and Spicy Flatbreads (roasted peaches! pickled jalapeÃ±os! pineapple glaze!) Sounds amazing, right? What actually showed up were three small plates of under seasoned, un-inspired food. All edible but all disappointing.   I've never been a fan of Heist's beer, either. When they first opened years and years ago, the beer was just plain awful. Ted tells me they make really good IPAs now, but I don't drink IPAs, soooooo... Again, on our most recent visit, they had about 6 IPAs, a pale ale and a barley wine on draft. I went with the guest tap cider. It was fine but as seems to be par for the course at Heist, pretty underwhelming.

This was my first visit to Heist Brewery, I came on a Saturday afternoon with a friend. We grabbed a seat at the bar, It wasn't crowded. Parking was a pain. I would recommend parking further down the street and walking. We sampled a few beers before ordering.   I tried the Blackberry Pick'n and the Good Road Blue ByWay. Both were great options! I liked the tart flavor of the Blackberry Pick'n and the blueberry cider flavor of the Good Road Blue ByWay. Heist Brewing also offers food. As we were leaving there was live music outdoors.

Went here for a late dinner - food was alright.  Nothing extraordinary.  Drinks were yummy!  Our server is the main reason for the lowered rating - she was rude from the moment we were seated until we left.  She had no patience for us when we needed time to actually look at the menu, when a friend joined us she was short with him.  The 'entertainment' of the evening asked for a jack & coke in between one of his songs, and she just gave him a nasty look before saying "okay." - then came back and just set the drink (that was for the band) on our table and walked off without saying a word.  We had to deliver the drink to the band.  When it was finally time to pay she started to just clear off the table without asking if we were finished - she even took my friend's beer that was still about half full that he was not finishing drinking.  She'd for sure benefit from some customer service training.

Great selection of food, beers and cocktails. The decor and vibe is really nice. They have a great outdoor space and huge indoor space. Tried the pretzel bites which were okay but would return to try other foods/drinks.

We have been here on multiple occasions. One thing that is always consistent is the beer cheese! We've had some hit and miss experiences as well especially with brunch. But since they have gotten their new chef, we have nothing but great things to say!
The pipe smoked salmon is absolutely delicious. The fish and rosemary tots were also wonderful.

We loved the atmosphere for a large birthday party celebration with 14 people, however the kids' choices are extremely limited. The adult food was fabulous, but our kids had 2 choices & their chicken tenders came fried almost black! The cheese pizza was fine. We ordered more tarot tots to fill them & they came badly over fried also. Very disappointing. We have taken them to brunch on Sundays and they loved that. May not go back for dinner with children.
Service was very good. Beer was too. Food was great too.  We celebrated my birthday there and left in a great mood.

First and foremost, this is a Brewery.  Therefore the beer receives high consideration.  Our party of four tried several different beers, none of which were very good.  I know this place is new so maybe they are still working out the kinks. But they have a long way to go.  Descriptive adjectives about the beer from our table - "flat", "watery" and "this is a bad beer".  Ouch!   In related news, even the tap water they serve had a very metallic taste. So maybe it's something related to the originally industrial water source?    Food - they have an eclectic and creative menu.  Unfortunately the execution of certain dishes was lacking.  The pretzel sticks with beer cheese are good for a group, but a far cry from real Bavarian style pretzels in flavor and texture.  The chicken and waffle sushi was the biggest hit with our party.  Not a lot of food but an original and creative dish all the same - great for four people to each get a sweet savory bite.  The Caesar salad was delicious and well-presented.  With lightly grilled romaine, fried anchovies and toasted pumpkin seeds, this one's a winner.  We also tried the little corndogs - good flavor, not a lot of food, needed another minute in the fryer.  But, overall, I thought the food was pretty durn good.    Other observations - I liked the space/decor (lots of cool ganster prints and big open spaces).  There are 3 or 4 bars, we were in the main room overlooking the copper beer thing-ys (vats?) and it was pretty chill.  I liked the music playing - think Black Keys, even some old Portishead, sort of grungy, bluesy rock -  it fits the space.  Our server was friendly but surprisingly unknowledgeable  about the menu.  At this price point, servers should have at least sampled the menu and be able to describe dishes and make recommendations.    Heist was packed on our Saturday night visit.  Hopefully the management will continue to work on execution because this place seems to have the potential to be really great or settling into mediocrity; bringing in hipsters who care more about the space and local than a higher echelon of crafted beer and quality food.

What can I say about Heist... The food is pretty good,  and if you can ever get seated you might even get to decide that for yourself. 2 out of the 3 times I've been here I've left with an empty stomach.  This place has a ton of potential however it's managed by a team of young hipsters that more than less likely are working to pay for their liberal arts degrees.   You would think that people destined to work at Starbucks would be able to manage people better.. Unfortunately that kind of greatness can't be expected overnight and apparently everyone here is still learning the in's and out 's of serving and restaurant management.  Dont worry young space cadets,  you'll get there.  Also,  good luck figuring out which door to enter.. I won't divulge those juicy details in this review... Some things are better experienced first hand.   On a side note,  the beer (the reason you come to a brewery)  is decent. The bloody mary's were crap (really... Who doesn't use Zing Zing?).    Enjoy!
Service was terrible. Barmaid was rude, and seemed absolutely uninterested in serving us. We will never go back to this place again!

Big fan... especially since none of the other local breweries really cater towards the dinning in experience quite like Heist does.  I know the focus should be beer, but why not have an awesome, cozy tasting room/dining room to go along with your delicious tasting beer?  Don't let the outside of the building fool you... it is very unassuming and blends in with the other NoDa buildings in the area, once you step inside, you feel like you are in a ski lodge with lots of natural woods and stones.  The beer makers are front and center behind glass and there is a bar with lots of tables around....  looks like there is a 2nd story for over flow seating (or private parties?).  Just an overall comfortable setting.  I had dinner there with a fellow yelp friend.  No expectations since I heard the opening was somewhat disorganized (might have been just too crowded).  Our server was pretty awesome she gave us solid recommendations and had tried everything on the menu save a couple items and had a distinct opinion about all of them!  I always think it's great when the employees are passionate about what they are talking about and providing.  We built our own flights and had flat breads and burgers... and were stuffed to delight.  Definitely need to come back and try more menu items!  of course the BEER too....  a lot of the normal brews were out, but they only serve fresh/seasonal beers so it makes sense that the menus were had to be clarified by the server - good thing we had a good one to give us the 411.

Dear Heist,  We've had our ups and downs since you first opened. But we've worked through the problems. Your beer has become amazing and your food is still consistently amazing. Your staff, especially Kelly and Andrew are top notch! And I've become a big fan again!  The highlights are your beer are the juicy IPAs and the Cataclysm series. The food options including the chorizo sliders, pork belly tacos and and brunch bowl with chorizo are all amazing.   It's nice to see a brewery listen to feedback from the community. I've taking crowlers of your beer elsewhere and you now have fans from all over.  My only complaint is the limited batches of your beer but I know you are working on that and opening a production facility soon.  Still, you've made it in my top 2 of Charlotte breweries. We've come a long way.   Thanks, Heist!

Came for the Sunday Brunch and holy cow, it was amazing. I really don't understand how I haven't been here yet. It was a person who eats a ton dream. We got there right before 11:30am, which seemed to be the perfect time to get there.....got there right before the crowds starting getting there. We had a party of 5 and we were seated immediately. Our waitress Sarah, was awesome....loved her. I was amazed by the amount of food options available at the buffet. They also had an omelette and waffle station (boy, was those waffles to die for). They are definitely about presentation when it comes to their food. They did an amazing job with that. The brunch is $15 and definitely a good bang for your buck. They also had $3 Bloody Mary's that were also phenomenal. Read reviews about how poor their beer selection is.....I didn't have beer during my visit, so I can't speak on that portion of it. I'm loving this place and I will for sure be back soon. Keep doing what you do..........

This place's brunch is amazing.  We went for brunch on Sunday and had a phenomenal time. First off, the value of their brunch is incredible. For $19 you order an entree (I had fried chicken with tempura fried egg over mac and cheese - yum; my friend had steak and eggs hash) and it comes with the brunch buffet which includes made-to-order waffles with a cinnamon apple compote, made-to-order flatbreads, hand carved local meats, chicken sausage, bacon, grits, potatoes, a fruit and veggie sampling and even more. Our server was the best. She was attentive and very welcoming. The ambiance is great - a bit packed for brunch but nothing I wouldn't expect for a place like this. I highly recommend! Also they allow pets on their quite large patio.

I recently visited Heist with a few colleagues for a Sunday Brunch celebration! We had worked a 300 person wedding the night before and thought we earned a hearty meal and a few drinks. I'm going to rate the value/food a 5, and the service/experience a 3, so rounding out to a 4.   The seating/reservation process was slightly confusing and ultimately it took us about 20 minutes to be seated (even though there were 6-8 tables in server's sections that weren't being used). This was after I spent 20 minutes literally stalking every person who left the building to try to grab their parking spot. Parking at this place is horrendous when it's busy.   Once we were seated, things went slightly more smoothly. I think that the waiter was overwhelmed and had too many tables, because it took quite a long time to get our drinks and subsequent refills. Often times we had to flag him down as he was running back and forth. However, since it was a buffet, we never had to wait for food so that was nice.   The value of the experience was definitely worth the price point of the buffet. I liked that you got to choose an a la carte option from the menu in addition to the buffet. I also liked the waffles (you have to request them from your server, but they were a hit).   Overall, once you can find parking and get a seat, things are good. I had a great peach bellini with my meal and my colleagues shared a mimosa pitcher. The pitcher itself was an odd shape and it kept spilling when they poured, but that could have also been the tipsiness.. : )

This is on the list of places that I really, really, really want to like. Something is just missing. I come back every few months hoping to like it. I am usually disappointed.  It is really beautiful inside. They have done a great job with fixing up the place. Sometimes it feels like they spent too much money on the dÃ©cor and not enough on the beer and food (this is a typical Charlotte problem that I have noticed)  Some of the food feels gimmicky- like the shrimp with cotton candy wrapped around it. The flatbread is meh. The most painful thing is the beer though. It just isn't good. I love a brewpub. Charlotte NEEDS a good brewpub. I don't think this is it. I know I sound like a harsh beer snob, but I really expected better beer.   The brunch- it is a buffet brunch. I'm just going to say it- I'm not sure if Charlotte needs another buffet brunch. It was pricey. It really wasn't that good (buffets aren't really my thing though)  POSITIVE- I did go here for a holiday dinner once. The food was not on the menu. They have stuffed chicken that was INCREDIBLE. The service was really good. This is actually a great space for a business luncheon or a holiday party.
Loved this place. Got a flight of beer and loved all of the choices. Their all American burger was awesome as well. Everyone at our table loved what they ordered.

Pretty disappointed in their gluten free menu. The shrimp dish came out fried and turns out it was fried with other gluten containing items- the manager did come out to talk to us but the conversation turned into an argument over what qualifies as gluten free. He also kept claiming to understand restrictive diets and kept talking about his personal dairy issues and not listening to the fact that we would have ended up extremely sick because of mislabeling on the menu.  I'm giving them 2 stars for offering options other than beer on the drink menu and for the fact that the waitress was nice and did a good job considering the situation.

I had heard from friends that a new-ish brewery in NoDa--Heist--had an amazing brunch deal for $15 brunch buffet and $10 bottomless mimosas. That's right. Unlimited champagne and orange juice heaven.  I knew there would be a wait so we decided to show up early to try to get space. I told everyone else to meet up at 12:00PM because in North Carolina you CAN'T SERVE ALCOHOL until noon on Sundays.   Before noon is God's time, and then it can be booze time the rest of the day.  It turns out for a table of 20 people, you're going to have to wait over 2 hours. I noticed for others coming in with 2-6 people, it was taking anywhere between 30 minutes-1 hour so that's not too bad.  But the wait was so worth it.  Our waiter had a mustache--typical NoDa.  The food--oh my gosh--the food. The whole back bar area is food buffets that include breakfast foods like eggs, sausage, and bacon, but also rum-soaked pineapple, flatbread breakfast pizza and more. The lunch stations had BBQ chicken legs, amazing mashed potatoes, & steak & veggie kebobs. Let's not forget the oyster bar [which I heard was good but I couldn't bring myself to try] and a waffle bar which was heaven on a plate.  And yes, they kept those mimosas flowing for us the whole time. Six mimosas later, I definitely felt like I got way more than my $10 worth. Adrienne got the bloody mary, and ay caramba, my taste of it was delicious. I didn't even know I liked bloody marys until I tried this one.  As a side note--I've also been here for late night drinks. Their beer cocktails are phenomenal [beer with liquor, liquer, or other mix-ins], and I've heard their late night small plates are even better, although we didn't try them.  To round it out: I love the building, I love this brewery, and I love this brunch.

We hit Heist around 3pm on a Tuesday and had the place pretty much had the place to ourselves.  We had beer flights which allowed us to sample several brews.  We enjoy Belgian style beers and these hit the spot.  We had a flat bread, pretzels with beer cheese and asian wings and they were all good.  Really wanted the pork belly corn dog, but learned that is only a dinner item.

This place was huge. Now I will say, for a brewery this size they had the smallest selection of on tap beer than any of the other breweries visited. The food was pretty good - did the special 4 course meal. The asparagus was too salty, the fish was good, the dessert was good but tasted too much like the gas torch that melted the marshmallows. Service was good, it got kinda dark though when they turned some of the lights off in the brewery part that was right next to where I was sitting. Lots of TVs, bathrooms were well kept.

Great set up.   Lots of space. Open floor plan.  Clean and packed.   This is a brewpub for sure.  I tried the heart if tartness. Papter tots.    Tryions table.  And   penny porter.   They were all solid beers but nothing really grabbed me.   Super nice bartenders.   Only tried the banana egg rolls but they were great.

I had such a bad experience there. Hostess staff didn't acknowledge us upon entering. I had to ask "can someone help us?!" It was like four of them standing there. They sat us at a table and it took the server a good 15 minutes to greet us (you are probably thinking why didn't we leave. Beautiful day for patio weather and drinks, plus we were in from out of town and on foot). It took him another 15 minutes to bring out our drinks. We were told that if we wanted food we could only get flatbreads. So we ordered the quesadilla, because that was considered a flatbread. Once it arrived, we had to send it back because there was hair on it. Took the server a long time to bring out the check.  TLDR: horrible service, hair in food, wouldn't go back
Yummy stouts  atmosphere was perfect    Thanks Natalie!  Service was excellent

What I would order again -  Fry Basket Crab Dip Beer Cheese Pork Belly Tacos Flight of beers for a person who hates IPA's.  What I wouldn't order again -  Chicken and Waffles - waffles are too dry Carne Asada Flatbread - Not enough carne Sweet & Spicy Dumplings - Taste is confusing - unanimous vote of three people. Chuck Wagon Wheels - I don't like the breading all over the meat.  Country fried anything tastes like the fried breading only...takes over all the flavor.

It is unfathomable to me how a place full of dbag hipsters and the nouveau riche can manage to be so sh*tty and pretentious serving mediocre food and awful beer. Customer service is nonexistent here and the place routinely smells like vomit. Seriously, what is that smell??? Much be the stink of the attitudes. Have been here with friends twice for celebrations. Would never voluntarily return with SO many better options in the neighborhood. Ugh. Hope this deliberately trendy place crashes and burns and makes space for a real, quality brewery and not something thrown up with a ton of money to attract past-their-prime frat boys trying to act like they can stomach something other than Bud.

I've been to Heist twice. The first time with a large group of friends and found their food excellent. Their beer, however was very watered down. As a beer lover, I found this very disappointing especially a from a brewery.   The second time I attended their brunch in a small group. As expected it was very busy, and it took about 10 minutes before our server came to take our initial drink orders. While it may not have been his fault, the management could have planned a little better by distributing their staff evenly to ensure better and more timely service. While their brunch looked appealing, the food was both cold and unimpressive. I had high expectations given their dinner menu but was disappointed when I ate cold mussels, eggs, hardened grits, and bacon. Fortunately, we also ordered from the a la carte menu and the omelette was more enjoyable than their brunch buffet.  In all, I may return for their dinner menu in hopes the they decide to stop watering down their beers. I will, however, never come back for brunch.

Loved this place.  Very fun and amazing food.  Four of us went and we shared the caesar egg rolls, cheeseburger flatbread, chicken and waffles (my favorite), beer cheese, and lobster pasta.  Every item was great and unique. Drinks were all good too.  We will definitely be back!

I was in Charlotte for an interview and after spending my morning getting interrogated with tough technical questions, I needed an afternoon drink (or 3) to get my good mood back. I'd bookmarked a handful of breweries but was bummed to find that none of them were open as early as I was ready to go tasting, so when I saw that Heist was open early AND had food, I headed straight over and found myself a seat at the bar.  I didn't know much about their beer before arriving, but was delighted to discover that they do a great balanced Belgian. Louisa, my awesome bartender was happy to let me try a few things, recommend new options based on my preferences and even told me I made the perfect choice for lunch in going with the mac and cheese flatbread (carbs on carbs, you guys!). I tried most of what they had on tap and selected three different pints, my fave being the Out to Pasture. Nothing was two sweet and they did have an american style IPA on tap for those of you that prefer a hoppier beer.   It was busier than I would have thought for Friday lunchtime, so good for them for being busy. If I ever find myself back in Charlotte I'll totally be back for more yummy beer, pretty good food and awesome service.

Ordered the seasonal pumpkin beer they had known as Saison De Pon Pon and it tastes more like a wheat ale with a hint of cinnamon.  I was hoping for something more 'Pumpkiny' but this wasn't it.. The pumpkin beer they provided said it was brewed with 200 lbs of pumpkin hence why I expected the 'Pumpkiny' taste...  I don't mind the beer though because wheat ale is definitely my go to when it isn't pumpkin season.  Ordered the BBQ burger which had a burger patty with caramelized onions, artisan lettuce, and pulled pork on top! Everything was very consistent with each bite! There was jalapeÃ±os and pepper jack cheese which tied everything together and you couldn't really taste the jalapeÃ±os because the BBQ pulled pork flavor was a bit overpowering.  Oh boy and let me tell you about their side of tator tots!!!! Its like little hash browns with a hint of ginger and cheese.  I couldn't quite figure out how they made it but it definitely is not the average tator tots you could buy at the store.  It was crunchy on the outside and cheesey and chewy on the inside.  I would definitely recommend this dish to anyone in the mood for a juicy BBQ type of burger.  And their booze to wash it down is definitely a plus! For people who appreciate good beer.. this is the place to be!  Hope this was helpful! Enjoy!

We had a fantastic time on their outdoor patio. The menu is so innovative: from limoncello wings to fig infused balsalmic oil, you can do no wrong here.  I'd definitely recommend the newest dark beer with pumpkin and chocolate notes.

I don't understand why people rave about the duck flatbread. It is roasted which is not a forgiving way to prepare duck and they need to shred it into very thin pieces because when you get a large chunk of duck in your mouth it's extremely gamey and I had to spit it out a few times.  yuck!

Oh Heist how you've disappointed me. I live around the corner and have gone to Heist a couple times to get dinner and cocktails and enjoyed it. This last visit was for brunch and oh man was it bad. The buffet was okay, although some hot items were cold and rubbery. Bacon was great! The worst part of our meal however were the "included" items on the menu that we each got one of. I got the steak and eggs. It had 3 tiny over cooked cold pieces of steak, a hard fried egg (I asked for over easy), cold potatoes, and a "steak sauce" that tasted like a rotten ketchup. We also ordered the breakfast burrito, which was essentially a taquito with cold black beans inside. I can't say I'll ever come back for brunch.
This is solely based on the food experience. I would say that overall the food quality was subpar and did not meet the pricing. If you were you order something i would recommend the duck flatbread.

We paid this place a visit for the first time this weekend.  It is large and the service great.  I had a cocktail that I thought was quite delicious...which was surprising for a brewery (my husband is the beer drinker and I am not).  And while the food was maybe a solid 3.5 stars, I really appreciated having some vegetarian options!  I really liked the mediterranean salad flatbread, but thought the pretzel appetizer could use some tweaking.  Overall, I would go back if someone wanted to go there, but probably wouldn't go back on my own.

Went back a couple more times since my first try and I can elaborate more on the food. We tried a flatbread that was pretty standard the first time and then went back for their $15 Sunday brunch (which goes till 3pm).   While everyone was extraordinarily friendly, I would go early as we went at 2:30 and everything tasted a little old & cold. I will say however that despite not tasting the best you could tell at one time it would have been delicious. My favorites of the day were the grits (some of the best I've had), the Belgian waffles ...awesome and made Fresh for you- huge plus in my case, and rum soaked pineapple with mascarpone. For those who like mimosa's they run an unlimited deal for only $10-not too shabby at all.    Suggestions - Better Quality OJ, and some fresher-lighter fare options. Everything was very heavy. Even the oysters had a decadent cream sauce. I would have loved just some simply dressed fresh veggies or even a light summer salad to break it up a little.    The buffet only gets a 2.5/5 but I think that really is because we came too late in the game. I wish they had kept rotating a bit more frequently, but I get that logistics hampers things a bit. I would give it another chance.

Was in Charlotte for the weekend and a friend invited me here for Sunday brunch. I give 5 stars for the young lady that served us that afternoon, she was a gem!  As for the ambiance, it's a brewery so not much to expect there. I was not a fan of the buffet style brunch and then having people getting the fruit from plastic bins and pouring it out instead of taking it to the kitchen. It's all in the details.   They are definitely not vegetarian friendly unless you just want to scarf down all the sweets and carbs on the table. For sure, a meat lovers dream! The potatoes and few items that I did try, I wasn't impressed at all. The fruit was warm and they had a pineapple glazed in rum that was not pleasing at all. I've tried much better version of that back home in Miami.   Great outdoor seating, TERRIBLE PARKING, and great service. You want a good time and don't really care about the food? This is definitely your place!

Unlike most breweries around Charlotte, they have an in-house kitchen. It's nice if you're not in the mood for a food truck. This place is great for sharing a bunch of food with a group and it has lots of options for vegetarians.  For a group of 3, we got the following food and it was plenty:  - Crispy Brussel Sprouts: crisped to perfection - Buffalo Cauliflower: fried but not greasy - Sweet and Spicy Pork Flatbread: delicious if you want to try something other than traditional flatbreads. Don't let the peaches freak you out! - Beer cheese and pretzels: I would give the beer cheese and 5 rating and the pretzels a 3.

Heist Brewery has come a looong way from what I remember a few years back. Not sure if many of you folks recollect but the beers here used to be "flat". Like, that was the intention - their claim to fame - was flat beers. Little to no carbonation. It was a hard start and people really talked a lot about it. Maybe it was intentional to get people in the door? I donno! But they did a big upset and flipped it all up one day.  They apparently hired a new brewmaster. The beers became stellar! Now you can find all manner of seasonal and small batch brews alongside their regular line up with lots of reliable flavors spanning the whole list of beer types. None of them flat! The bar staff is extremely helpful even at popular times - and they get a LOT of attention these days. So much so that the parking lot can be quite a bit of a pain. But as the weather warms up, a leisurely stroll to Heist from NoDa proper could be well rewarded with a cold one.  Oh and did I mention the finger foods? I've been in here on special events a time or two which were well catered, although I should probably refrain from reviewing since I haven't tried their full menu.
